Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: d1971brb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Union Square for four days in April. My wife had a meeting at the Hyatt around the corner and we stayed at the Marriott for the reward points. The Marriott was not real fancy...It had no restaurant to speak of. But the rooms were clean and functional. The staff was extra friendly and attentive. I made jokes with the bellmen that I was going to sneak out before they could open the door for me. I always lost. The location is nice and there are lots of good restaiurants in the area. I walked three blocks to the Top Of The Mark Hopkins for lunch one day, and we liked the steakhouse at the Westin Saint Francis just down the block. We took the double-decker buses and could get anywhere in SFO. One day, we bused to the north end of the Golden Gate and walked all the way back through the Presidio, Marina District, Fort Mason, Fishermen's Wharf, and Lombard Street. If you are not into trying to kill yourself on possibly the most famous city hills in the world, the cable car is just outside the hotel. Overall, a nice, reasonably priced hotel in a wondeful city.

Reviews.Title: “April Holiday with daughter”
Reviews.Author: Lillian M
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely decorated and clean. We were on the 25th floor and the view was awesome. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is the cost of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Re-Do!”
Reviews.Author: MDa411
Reviews.Content: this place has had a remarkable changeover. the rooms have all been updated with especially nice bathrooms. if you're from europe and/or are used to "european standards" for hotel rooms, you'll be quite pleased with this hotel. and, epecially for out-of-towners, you will not find a better, more central location--Union Square, Chinatown, Yerba Buena are just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near sites and great shopping!”
Reviews.Author: DCSenorita
Reviews.Content: Just blocks from Union Square. Close to shopping, drugstores, Starbucks, and right off the street car.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Service”
Reviews.Author: Mattttttttttt
Reviews.Content: From the moment my family and I arrived we were treated to the best San Francisco has to offer! Great check-in and welcome by everyone. One vehicle 4 adults and 1 child equals 10 bags. The bell staff could not have been happier to assist and help direct me with directions to all the area sites! Great breakfast in the hotel, recommend doing the buffet so you can enjoy the omelets and yogurt parfaits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Home Base”
Reviews.Author: ScottNReston
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was in awe by the most elegant lobby. The check in was easy and fast, but moreover got some great tips on local eateries and a fantastic little wine bar not far. Room was super clean on the Executive level. Bath was small, but would expect that in San Fran - but a little counter space would be nice. Restaurant and Bar above average and wait staff very pleasant and fun to talk with. The wine tasting was fun and discovered a little bit more about "wine country". Major plus was the responsiveness of every person who works at this hotel. I felt appreciated and moreover like a friend. By the 4th night most staff that I encountered called me by name. Very nice way to end a day of sightseeing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, cozy, and clean”
Reviews.Author: jimtokunaga
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with three of us sharing a room. It was a little crowded but was'nt expecting anything too big. The bathroom was not as small as I was expecting based on the reviews, in fact was quite okay even for the three of us. Frosted glass doors so if your modest it may be uncomfortable. Ample closet space and drawers. We we're on the 24th floor so there was no street noise. There is a coffee maker in the room but it was single cup (individual packets) maker so it took awhile to make 3 cups, this also created a lot of trash. No refrigerator in the room so we could not keep cold drinks in the room. All in all it was a great location not on Union Square but a blovk north. There is a Starbuck across the street on Sutter. If your driving like we did, parking at hotel (valet) is $49 per day, but there is a self park garage right next door on Sutter for $39 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Service For a Big City Marriott- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: The Union Square Marriott on the corner of Powell and Sutton has a lot to recommend it. The location can't be beat with Union Square right outside the door and the Powell and Mason Cable Cars passing right in front of the hotel. The rooms are standard Marriott, i.e reliable and clean. The lobby and public areas are modern and inviting. Best of all the staff is very nice and the service from the check-in to the housekeeping to the bell man is all top-notch. As busy as this place was every encounter I had with a staff member was pleasant and polite. I didn't sleep all that well due to noisy neighbors but that was not the hotel's fault. Finally my room on the 25th floor had a great view of the bay ,the Coit Tower and Trans America building. Very nice to open the curtains at night and just take it all in. I would definitely stay here again even with all the choices in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for what I got and nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: I paid for a high floor corner suite and got what I paid for on the 24th floor. No upgrade was available, although I asked, so I paid extra for access to the concierge lounge. The concierge lounge was disappointing with breakfast offerings and evening drinks (you have to pay extra $5 for each beer and wine) which I think is not worth the extra $35 paid. The corner junior suite does have a great view and large bathroom than the standard rooms. No slippers, shower cap, and the toilet paper is thin as it can be. Registration staff was unprofessional and need more training, but the doorman and housekeeping were great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, small bathroom, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NIonadi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block off Union Sq. and is in extremely convienant to Downtown shops, restaurants, cable cars and a number of businesses. Request a room on a higher floor (above 15) to avoid street noise but also provides a great view of the city. If your fortunate enough to have access to the concierge, this is one of the best that I have seen. The view of the city is amazing, the food quality and choices are very good and the staf is very friendly and accomodating. They provided really good recommendations on restaurants both nights of my stay. The only negative on the hotel room is the size of the bathroom. It has everything you need but is on the small side for counterspace.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet, tasteful”
Reviews.Author: CA_KDM
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Union Square property has neither the charm nor the tradition of other celebrated San Francisco hotels like the Mark Hopkins, etc, but it impresses with efficiency and simple understated elegance. Located right on the Powell Street cable car route and one block from Union Square, the hotel is ideal situated as a base for either a business trip or vacation. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful starting with the doorman and continuing to the housekeeping crew. Everyone smiles and greets you as if you were their only guest. A nice, unexpected touch at a big (big-city) hotel. We arrived late on a Monday afternoon and were given a northwest facing corner room with wonderful views of the city including portions of the Bay Bridge, Coit Tower,and Alcatraz. The appointments were simple, functional, and comfortable, especially the wonderfully comfy bed. If you are an Elite member of Marriott's Guest program, be sure to visit their Concierge Lounge. The views of the city to the south, east, and west are spectacular and the continental breakfast features freshly baked croissants and pastries along with the more traditional morning fare. We really wished we could have stayed longer but, since our schedule called for an early departure on Tuesday morning, we had too little time to fully enjoy this first class hotel. We are already looking forward to a return trip and will definitely stay at this gem of a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Business hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Katy1234585
Reviews.Content: Standard business hotel in central city location. Staff very friendly and efficient. Rooms clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Denise R
Reviews.Content: coming from boston and living in Sam mateo i love treating myself and visitors to a night in the wonderful city of San francisco. I always love to stay and the marriott In Union Sq due to its prime location. You are feet away from the cable cars, resturaunts and unbelievable shopping. Rooms are 5 star and marriott make sure you feel at home while enjoying your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AuntBee13
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a 5 night stay at this location and would recommend to any city visitor. Basic breakdown of the property as the location is your typical higher end Marriott property. Pros: Perfect Location: I prefer Union Square over any other area of the city. Much more centrally located than the Wharf where most tourists seem to stay. VERY close to all the Union Square shopping and restaurants. Cable car runs right next to the hotel on Powell street. Service: From check-in to housekeeping this is a highlight of this property. One of my buttons on a sportcoat I brought came off one evening. I had it laid on my desk. To my surprise after the housekeeper had cleaned the next day she had sewn the button back on! Now that is way beyond any expected service. Doormen are great for hailing cabs. Huge Lobby: Unlike many of the other hotels in the city this property has a large lobby perfect for meeting up with others or just hanging out. As others have stated the the rooms are on the smaller side and the bathroom is on the very small side. Otherwise this is an outstanding Marriott property. Very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “the reason to stay - Best location”
Reviews.Author: Vivek R
Reviews.Content: I stay mostly at Marriotts for business and mostly the services are good but the location isnt .. . But this one @ Union Square is awesome ..you step out you have so many options for pub , restaurants .. Fisherans Wharf is so close . I was staying @ 23rd floor ans the view was great .. And I really enjoyed it..the rooms are small but you need to compromise it for the amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BudGirl17
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of hotels that you can stay in, in Union Square, but by far and away, I'd be very happy to stay at this Marriott property again! We came out to San Fran for business and booked at the Marriott Union Square, in the Club Level Rooms. The bump up in price from a standard room is by far and away worth every little penny to upgrade. The cost to upgrade every day we were there was less then breakfast would've cost at the hotel and we were able to enjoy the "Club" throughout the day! To begin, our plane was 45 minutes early arriving and we made our way to the hotel, in the hopes that one of our five rooms might, on the off chance, be ready. Here we met Susan, who was incredibly helpful, sweet, fast and nice! She moved some things around and found us not one, but two rooms that we could start with- which was beyond helpful to throw our bags in before our first appointment. We ran up to the "Club" quickly after that to grab a water and met Daniel, who was one of the team members in charge of the club at the time. He continued the trail that Susan had blazed with being incredibly helpful, with all kinds of hints to get around the city, what to do, what to do, what to maybe avoid and things that were definitely must-see items. It was also helpful to run into Daniel because he let me know that the car service that we booked for the following day could actually be backed up a half an hour because the traveling time was not as long as the company had told me to plan for. We were helped, several times, by the entire team at the front desk, and the bellmen, with directions of how to get where we were going, how to find the nearest cable car stop and how to get to the destination we were trying to find. They were always at the ready to help each and every guest. Every single team member at this hotel was nice, helpful and efficient. The Club level breakfast was awesome! Scrambled eggs, homemade oatmeal, toast/bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, coffe/tea - just about anything you'd order from room service. We did not get to enjoy lunch there any of the days we were there, nor what they had around dinner time, but snacks and dessert were great and it was always helpful to be able to run up and grab a water/diet soda, etc throughout the day at the drop of a hat. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the beds were wonderful! I'm not a great sleeper at hotels to begin with but the beds were very comfortable and I actually got a great night's sleep. I understand that because we were on one of the "club" floors that we had a room that was high up above all the traffic noise below, and the room was pretty quiet as hotel rooms go. I read many accounts of the bathrooms being on the small side and I would say this is the very tiny, only bad thing about this entire hotel, which is really saying a lot. The counter space, at least for this lady, is really quite small and there really isn't much room for make up and toiletries, etc. They even had more room to move it over, but it is located about five inches from the shower. I did find, if you move the shower curtain over to the opposite wall, which seemed like the sensible thing to do, that it gave you the feel of having more room and not being pushed out by the shower curtain. This hotel also has a computer in the lobby to print off boarding passes, etc and was efficient as well! All in all, this is an absolutely wonderful hotel, it's in a great location to cable cars, restaurants, stores, shopping etc that I'd stay here again in an instant. The team that works here represents their hotel very well and they should be proud of how wonderfully they represent the brand. (I work in marketing, can you tell?). But I'd tell anyone looking for a great hotel, that this is a terrific place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business travel but too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Vezich
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a week in downtown San Francisco on business and I can't really complaint about this hotel. It's clean, staff is courteous. A special thanks to Diana at the front desk who was able to quickly accomodate my request for a high floor at an early check-in time. The location is very good, close to Union Square, Market street, and Powell-Mason cable car line just around the corner. The room was clean, bedding extra comfy. Nice flatscreen TV with HDMI input to play movies from the computer (bring your cable!). The room was a little small (one of the smallest room on the floor, due to location of elevators), but it was okay, considering I was there by myself. Extra charge for Internet access: 12.95 per day. It seems valet parking is available, but the price may be outrageous. Pros: location, cleanliness, bedding, staff courteousy Cons: no pool or spa - that could have been a big plus after a long day of walking the city. I would have given this hotel a 5 should the price had been more decent.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Baabay
Reviews.Content: very friendly helpful staff! Convenient to cable car, other site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter494
Reviews.Content: There are two Marriott hotels in Union Square. This stay was at the one on the corner of Sutter and Stockton STs. The hotel is a nice property with doormen opening the doors as you enter and exit. Staff was friendly and attentive. The lobby isn't much: basic space to support check-in, check-out, a bell desk, and access to a restaurant. The rooms are comfortable with a cushy bed, flat-screen tv, desk, and great views (if you are on a high floor). Space is a bit tight. The room had a feeling of a long, narrow galley. I was disappointed that there wasn't a place (other than the desk) inside the room to eat. The closet was also small. Rather than a bar across the entire closet, there were to bars running from front to back. This allowed the closet to be more narrow. This might work well for people with roller bags. It was a nuisance for me because I have a hanging bag. Once the bag was suspended across the two bars, hanging clothes had to either be hidden behind my bag or placed in front, limiting access to the bag. Tolerable, but annoying. Most frustrating was the size of the sink in the bathroom. It was tiny with limited space for tools (hair brushes, shavers, toothbrush/toothpaste, etc.). And using it I felt cramped by the shower curtain on a curved rod that caused it to insinuate itself into the space for the sink. I couldn't get it out of the way enough to not feel cramped as a shaved or brushed my teeth. Maid service was attentive. And, as a frequent stayer, I received nightly turn-down service: closing the curtains, a brief tidying up of the room, and leaving two chocolates on my pillow. My Marriott status also entitled me to the use of the Concierge Lounge. The lounge served a breakfast of oatmeal, cold cereal, scrambled eggs, the usual unripe fruit (cantaloupe, honeydew, and pineapple), and good pastries. The croissant were crispy and flaky. There were scones, pain au chocolate, and various fresh sweet rolls. Orange juice was served at breakfast. Coffee, and a selection of teas, soda, and beer are available throughout the day. The afternoon snacks were disappointing. Turkey and ham sandwiches on focaccia, a hot appetizer (e.g., mini vegetable spring rolls that were mostly fried dough with limited vegetable filling), a tiny vegetable "salad", and a cold antipasto tray that usually included slices of sausage, cheese, and olives. A later dessert included an assortment of three mediocre cakes and brownies. A nice feature is that the lounge is open all day even when food is not being officially served. Soda, coffee, and tea remain available. Between meals, mixed nuts, pretzels, and freshly baked cookies are also available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: khobama
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the modern look of the place. Can't beat the location and views from our room. Staff was always very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Europe-07-09-11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for Union Square and Market St shopping. Great energy in th evenings and great for walks, shopping and dining. 4 blocks from the big Market Street shopping area and one block from Union Square. Our biggest choice is whether we'd rather stay over by Fishermans Wharf vs Union Square. Weve done both and they both have something different to offer. Good service throughout our stay. Parking is steep but that's unavoidable.

Reviews.Title: “pick a higher floor”
Reviews.Author: Dhender
Reviews.Content: alls well in Marriottville ! just the street noise can get you down so pick a higher floor. Menu is fairly limited and NO ROOM SERVICE from 11am til 5pm (I arrived exhausted and jet lagged at 11:05am having not eaten in 12 hours so that was not good).

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: pvickwoo
Reviews.Content: Used hotel points so not sure what the rate would have been. We took the BART from the airport, so it ended up being quite a few blocks with our luggage and crowded sidewalks. But is a very good location to Chinatown and Union Square. Once we found out the costs for parking, we decided to wait to rent-a-car after doing our "city" tours, although it's one of the cheaper places to park. Also disappointed there wasn't free internet although found that not too many hotels offered it. Even cities "outside" the city charged for parking and internet. But there is a Starbucks directly across the street from the hotel where there is free wi-fi. The beds were very comfortable but no fridge in the room and nothing else special with the stay. May check into another Marriott property next time if I'm using points just to compare,

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: JillBayne
Reviews.Content: My family has a Marriott membership so this is not my first Marriott stay. What can I say? It was lovely, the rooms were accommodating and clean, the staff was so helpful and the breakfast really worked for my family. The best part about the Marriott on Union Square is definitely the location, it's in the heart of the shopping district and my trip was all about shopping. Great week at the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place.”
Reviews.Author: JosephFord
Reviews.Content: Heard that Union Square hotels are not good so we went with a name brand and it was very nice. The staff was very professional and friendly. Our room was really clean and we slept so well.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hunter M
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this Marriott. The hotels exterior does little justice for the really posh and has a great contemporary design theme. The lobby is very open and has plenty of nice sitting area and has a great bar. The bar service is also top notch and the bartenders will give you the best advice of where to go and have a fun night on the town. The drinks are a little pricy, but it is expected for a hotel bar. It is in a great location right near Chinatown and in the heart of Union Square and you can practically walk anywhere. We walked all the way to Fisherman's Wharf one day and it was really enjoyable because you can take everything in that San Francisco has to offer. Only complaint is the cost of WiFi per day... They have a wonderful breakfast also, top notch! Other than that, it was an overall great place to stay and super helpful staff that will do anything in the world for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very nice bar”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and nice big rooms. The bar is excellent, I highly recommend their cocktails! Only a negative thing: short dark hairs in the bathroom, I have long blonde hair so not quite mine : (

Reviews.Title: “Great functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: ticklu64
Reviews.Content: Great location near union square. Walking distance to all other hotels and attractions. Nice modern rooms although the bathrooms are lightly small. Helpful conceirge. Not exactly 5 star luxuary but then again its a busness hotel. I would recommend this hotel. Key disadvantage may be the noise of people on the street especially on a friday night. So a higher floor room not facing the street may be better.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco weekend!”
Reviews.Author: jamietucker
Reviews.Content: We took a ride up to San Francisco to see our son's new place of employment and where he was living, a 4 hour trip from our home on the Central Coast. The hotel staff are very welcoming and accommodating! The servers in the restaurant, Bin 480, are helpful with menu choices, as well as wine and well drinks. The Bell Men are courteous and knowledgeable about the area. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a central location; walking distance from many of the attractions of The City. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely visit it again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas T
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We actually took 2 rooms because we have two teenage daughters. We had only booked one room and it was a spur of the moment decision to take 32 as we had saved money during the trip. The hotel was very accommodating in giving us a second room. The hotel is very close to the major tourist attractions and Fisherman's Wharf is only short cable car ride away. It is also close to some good eateries (see separate reviews of Lori's Diner).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - Tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Leslie D
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. We were in town December 12, 2011 for a wedding and this hotel housed many of the wedding guests. They were wonderful about warning us to allow enough time to find a taxi as it was a huge problem at that time of the year. The only issue I had was the size of the bathroom. It had a tiny sink and I had to lean over the toilet to put on make up using the mirror. I actually dropped and broke the cases of some of my make up. It was clearly not a big enough space for 1 guest, yet alone, two. There was a larger than necessary entrance to the room. It would provide enough space for a decent sized bathroom the next time they remodel. We had lunch in the restaurant which was good. I filled out a comment card upon leaving, but never heard from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: drum_bum
Reviews.Content: I really loved the decor and feel of this hotel. The furishings and interior design were modern - clean lines, warm colors - had a fresh atmostphere. Very close to shops, cable car stop, restaurants. Nice staff. A keeper for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service!”
Reviews.Author: TerMil17
Reviews.Content: This is our fist time staying at this hotel for our annual trip to San Francisco after Christmas. Check-in was smooth and we even got to check-in earlier. The bell desk staff are great and are always there to help. Front Desk staff who checked us in was very helpful. We got a 2 double bed room and it is spacious considering this is San Francisco. The location is great, 1 block to the Union Square and it's close to everything. You can even take the Cable Car ride from the corner of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas vacation”
Reviews.Author: rosscannon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/22/11 through 12/27/11. Had a room on the 26th floor that gave us a great view of the city and the bay. The room was reasonably-sized with a very comfortable king-size bed. The hotel staff from desk clerks to doormen were always friendly and courteous. The hotel is as well located as any the city in terms of its proximity to shopping and restaurants in the downtown area. The hotel has been significantly upgraded since it has become a Marriott. Bathroom is a little tight with little shelf space. The closet is small and the hangers run from front to back instead of side to side making hanging and retrieving things somewhat inconvenient. There is no mini-refrigerator in the room although there is a cabinet for one. Although we didn't eat in either of the restaurants they looked attractive. All in all it is an excellent hotel with what we think are reasonable rates for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: RMTCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12/17 to 12/19 during the Christmas rush and had a great time. Very well run, clean place with attentive staff. Valet parking is steep ($50/night!) but parking around Union Square is expensive in general. We had a junior suite on the 16th floor overlooking the Cable cars and Nob Hill. The location, 1 block off Union Square is ideal. Having the cable car line right there is also key. It's about an easy 20 minute walk to the Ferry Building and all of that great food (think Quincy Market in Boston). Had breakfast and a snack at the resaurant and lounge area and both were very good with some light fare for snacks that were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beaten as many reviewers have mentioned. Rooms were very clean & a good size, especially the corner rooms (see room tip below). There's actually free wifi BUT this is something the hotel won't tell you as when we checked in & asked, they said it was all PAID wifi. But our son discovered the free wifi in the lobby - worked for our iPad & iPhones. Not sure about laptops though but I would think it should work. You have to set up your free account in the lobby first before you can access the free wifi in your room. Go to your phone settings & choose the Marriott wifi. Launch your browser & log in to the per day (24 hrs) free wifi. Then you can use it for free in your room. Otherwise it'll cost you $13 if you request a password etc from the hotel. My 2 bugbears would be that there's no kettle to boil water but a "disposable" type coffee maker. And there's no mini fridge either which we really like to have when staying for a week with the family.

Reviews.Title: “SF Marriott Union Square - makes your stay smooth and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Lamboswede
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is one of my absolute favorite cities in the World and I usually say that Stockholm and San Francisco are the most beautiful cities in the World. This visit did not dissapoint either. The vibrant city is just faboulus and I often think about San Francosco because the city has attidtude, lovely architecture and some really good shopping. This time I chose to stay at the Marriott Union Square at 480 Sutter streat. The hotel does have a very central location which makes it really attractive from that perspective. The checkin process was smooth and not att all cumbersome. I had a car this time so I parked just in front of the hotel and that is all good but the problem is that there is no real hotel parking area which feels a bit unsecure as you are close to the traffic, not a huge deal but maybe something to think about if you are traveling with children because then it is extra important to make sure that they do not exit on the left side of the car due to the traffic. The parking fee was 45USD which is quite expensive for 1 day parking but thinking about the fact that you are downtown San Francisco then it is probably not that bad. The rooms are very nice, modern, clean and offers a nice street view. What I really like is when I can open the window which actualy was possible even on the 12th floor. The rooms are also quite big with a very comfortable bed and furniture, they just had safebox installed which also add some extra security if you are bringing a computer or other high-value items. The hotel feels actually much more modern than the JW Marriott hotell just a block away and the Marriot Union Square has a nice design in lobby. I like this hotel and I will most likely book it again. Unfortunately I did not have the opportunity to try their breakfast because of my 0710 flight from SFO so that is something I will try next time. If you are looking for a downtoan hotel which is modern and does not totally rip you of I believe that this is a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in December 2011 for a conference. The staff could not have been more accommodating. Everything from the great bar and dinner menu at Bin 480 to the always jovial doormen, this place is a class act. The room was beautiful, the views were beautiful, so much that I kept my curtains open all night so I could fall asleep to the twinkling city lights. The rooms were spotless and the beds so comfortable. I just with I could have stayed here for longer. It felt so nice to come back to this hotel after long conference days at the Moscone Center. Thank you San Francisco Marriott Union Square. Oh, one thing. If you get a chance to visit the Lobby Bar, say hi to Steve. He is a great guy to talk to!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, central location”
Reviews.Author: Terrie T
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at the Marriott Union Square when in San Francisco for a vacation. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is helpful and courteous. The hotel is in a central location for a San Francisco vacation. We could walk or get public transportation to almost everywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott hotel with a boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: craignsandra
Reviews.Content: We had excellent service from the time we arrived, and the hotel is in a perfect location for wonderful shopping and excellent restaurants. The bar/restaurant has great food and drinks and is very inviting and comfortable. I loved the room, it wasn't very big but the space was used well, and the furnishing was modern and useful. We also had a great view, I just can't say enough wonderful things about this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff, but felt "nickeled & dimed"”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: Great location near cable cars, restaurants, shopping, Chinatown, etc. Staff (predominantly Asian) very helpful and friendly. Our 21st floor room was spacious, nicely decorated and had picture-postcard views of the city. The heater was noisy. We chose it because we could get a king bed for us and a sofa bed for our teenager. Most SF hotels only offer two double beds. Apparently a base for an Asian airline's staff. Like many centrally located San Francisco hotels, though, there are no amenities. Not even coffee in the morning (but Starbucks is right across the street). Parking is expensive. Even when we did not use the valet parking and parked next door, it was $39 per day, but we did have in-and-out priveleges. Our teenager used his ITouch in the room, so we had a surprise extra charge for WiFi of $13.95 per day! Had to call on two occassions because they did not leave enough towels for the three of us. Otherwise, it is hard to have a bad time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location?”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: Standard and solid Marriot experience. Conflicted about the location, because you are one block away from Union square (perfect!), but it is quite busy and noisy in the street down below. Some rooms are much smaller than others, so you have to be careful... would recommend rooms in the 06 and 16 series, as they are bigger corner rooms. Staff was really friendly and helpful. Great meeting venues... their meeting rooms in the 30th floor offer spectacular and inspiring views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Nut
Reviews.Content: I just completed my first stay at the SF Marriott Union Square, and I look forward to returning. Having recently made Gold status with Marriott this year, I decided to make a switch from the SF Hilton, and I cannot be happier! I was given a corner room that was extremely well appointed. I absolutely loved having usable power plugs on both bedsides, as well as an entertainment hook-up console. The bathroom was a touch small, but had a convenient ledge below the mirror for storage. The executive lounge was comfortable, and the snacks standard Marriott fare. The staff throughout the hotel were extremely courteous and attentive. And, oh yes, I barely heard any street noise, very unlike my experience with other SF hotels. The location is great, just 1 block from Union Square, and a short walk to the Financial District. I am glad I made the switch, and found this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice when I am in Sf.”
Reviews.Author: mators
Reviews.Content: The customer service is excellent..the room is comfortable and big enough, the beddings were clean, thats the one I check first and the bathroom...the only downside is you have to pay your wireless internet with the price you pay per night...the location is the best because I can just walk around where I wanna go...

Reviews.Title: “Great locale in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler113
Reviews.Content: My family of four, children 18 and 12, spent two nights at this Marriot at the end of August. This hotel has a great location to take in all the sights of San Francsico. It is located on the trolley car line and many destinations are walkable. The hotel staff and concierge were extremely helpful. We did not eat any meals at the hotel since there were so many great choices with walking distance - Chinatown and Little Italy, We took a trip to Muir Woods. We left early, as suggested, and got ti the woods at around 8:30. It was empty. We just thought that the msity weather had kept people away. There is also no charge for entrance at this time. It was great to leisurely tour the woods with so few people around. We could linger as long as wanted and take many pictures. When we left a few hours later, there were thrings of people entering the woods. We then ventured to Sauslaito for lunch. What a great little town, We thoroughly enjoyed shopping and walking along the water. We also saw Ghiradelli Square, Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street and the Goldent Gate Bridge. All in all a great few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobalucchi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 3 different hotels in Union Square in the last 6 months and the Marriott is top of the list. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable for a solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Ange85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in mid-June on my own during a 4 day visit to San Fran. I was upgraded straight away after telling check in staff about a horrible experience at a nearby hotel the night before. All staff were very accommodating - offering some good recommendations on tours and diners. The hotel itself has been renovated and still feels quite new. The location is also perfect for someone who wants a central base to explore this beautiful city for the first time. You can walk around Union Square and to Chinatown - I felt safe doing this alone at night too. FIsherman's Wharf is also just a short Cable Car ride or you can get a taxi for $10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KChaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for two nights during the Nike Women's Marathon the weekend of October 15, 2011. I was pleasantly surprised on how nice the hotel was. The room was very nice, comfortable and very clean. The bathroom was on the small side, but clean and definitely manageable. It was a nice surprise that they had Bath and Body Works as their tolietries. The bed was very comfortable and cozy. The staff at the Marriott were very welcoming and friendly - great service. Everyone that we met (front desk, valet, bell service, etc.) were very accommodating and very, very nice. We had a drink and an appetizer down at the bar. Nice bar - you can sit by the window and people watch too. The location was awesome. One block from Union Square and a few blocks from Chinatown. It was a great and convenient location. You can even catch the cable car on the corner. Shopping is all around the hotel so you can shop until you drop! Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: scubascaff
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice Marriott. Rooms are good, views were amazing, and service was impeccable. You HAVE to try their pancakes- I don't know what they do to them, but they were the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. For two of us, breakfast all week was $50 a morning- steep. The continental breakfast doesn't include much- but they are willing to accommodate for free. Wifi is pricey, as is parking, but to be expected I suppose. I would definitely stay here again. Great hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: carmanc5
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a first time at this property. It is one block from Union Sq. It is close to many restaurants, pubs, and shopping. The Cable cars pass within feet of this property. It is located at the corner of Powell and Sutter. I found the service very good from the staff. We were given good advise on places to eat and good recommends on transpartation to key parts of the city. We were originally assigned a room on the 23rd floor. There were OK views of the city from here. After one night we asked for a room with a better room and the staff came through again! We were reassigned the rest of our stay to the 27th floor and Wow what a difference a few floors make! We could see the bay and Alcatraz Is! It was beautiful! So my advice on rooms would be to request 27 to 30. There are I believe 30 floors. In conclusion the hotel and the staff really helped us with a very nice experience in a very interesting city!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, great service”
Reviews.Author: nedhop
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on either side of dental implant surgery next door to the hotel. We booked a "junior suite;" it was really just a large room with king size bed, sofa, desk, easy chairs, and a separate bathroom as big as some European and Asian hotel rooms I've stayed in. The suite was a corner room with large windows facing both Sutter and Powell. Those windows were effectively soundproofed. Following the surgery I was not at the top of my game. I checked out forgetting that I'd left an Asus notebook computer in a desk drawer. Two hours later, from home, my wife called the hotel. The clerk said they'd found the computer and would either mail it to me or hold it for me to pick up. Given the number of items I've lost to theft in other hotels, this was remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jmnNy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for two nights at the end of our two week California road trip. The rooms are very clean and the bathroom is a decent size. A little small but it was fine for us. Very clean. The last night we stayed in and ordered room service. The food was good, but you have to be very specific. We ordered a hamburger instead of a cheeseburger and we were sent a cheese burger and they forgot to send the other meal we ordered. The correct order was eventually sent to us, but that was just annoying. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of Union Square walking distance to all the shops, restaurants and China Town, the Financial District. A nice walk to the Ferry Building and Market Street. You can also walk to Fisherman's Warf but make sure you wear good walking shoes. It is a 30 - 40 minute walk away and the hills of SF are very steep. Great workout though and I highly recommend walking around the city to really see it. The hotel is also a short walk to the Clift Hotel which has an awesome lounge to have drinks before of after dinner. On the same street of the Clift is Ryoko Sushi - very good sushi and open late. Fun loud scene and casual. If you have time you should definitely do a tour of Alcatraz but make sure to purchase tickets a few days in advance because the tours do sell out. Overall, very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: jmtrup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 2-5, 2011 and it was exactly what I expected. Traveling with kids, we requested a double room and recieved a corner room on the 20th floor. The room was generously oversized - almost the size of two rooms - and easily accommodated a roll away bed without feeling cramped. Location is great, easy access to the cable cars and Union Square with plenty to do within walking distance. As with most full service hotels, nothing is free. Valet parking was $50 a day, but neighboring garages only charge a few bucks less. Wireless was about $13/day, but fees are waived for Elite guests. Elite guests can also access the Conceirge Lounge on Level 28 which has an adequate continental breakfast (eggs, fruit, muffins, rolls, etc), evening hors d'oeuvres, after dinner desserts, and "honor bar" ($5 beer/wine, free water and soft drinks)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but hotel is missing a few basics”
Reviews.Author: mortenag
Reviews.Content: The room is fairly new, probably among the newer in San Francisco. Has AC, but no safe nor mini bar. A very nice fitness room which allows you to do cardio while travelling and some weights. I'm very disappointed that you have to pay for internet, $13/day. In 2011, this should be free. the service is generally good, but the I had some bad experiences with a grumpy guy in the reception. Bathroom is very good, with a lot of towels stacked under the sink (3 of each type) in addition to the ones on the hangers. The room has an iron and a ironing board. I was here during a conference, which had made Marriott (almost) triple the rate to 375/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: goddess2230
Reviews.Content: What a great location, close to tons of shopping and restaurants in Union Square. The cable car picks up right on the corner and takes you all the way to Fisherman's Wharf. Also a short walk to Chinatown and if you don't mind walking, North Beach area. We rarely used the car because it was so much easier to walk than deal with parking. Speaking of, don't use the hotel parking, its outrageously expensive. Park on the next corner down in the Sutter-Stockton garage instead. For us it was cheaper to park there for 2 days and nights than one night at the hotel and its a very short walk. We had a room on the 19th floor. Great view of the city and the bay and you couldn't hear much city noise. The bathroom was crazy small with no space to put things. The lack of an in-room safe was a little odd, especially for a Marriott property. To clear things up on internet usage, it is not free. Both wired and wifi access cost $12.95 per day, which is outrageous compared to all other hotels where its complementary. Perhaps if you are a top-tier rewards card member its free, but mine is a silver level and its definitely not free. Overall, the hotel was nicely decorated, comfy bed, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the quality I expected”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: I had a week for meetings in San Francisco. I am tempted to credit the hotel for the fabulous fall weather, but that was the best thing for the week. I checked in and using my Marriott Gold asked for my expected upgrade. I don't know if it was an upgrade, but if it was, the room had the smallest closet I have seen in any hotel. I couldn't even fit my suitcase in the closet. There was no safe (a usual amenity for Marriotts). The bathroom was also tiny, with no room to put toiletries. An expected wake-up call was late. I expected more. Perhaps the old Crowne Plaza influence still shows through the Marriott redecoration

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-Small Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: STETSONANNE
Reviews.Content: My room in the Marriott was clean and comfortable. It was atttractivly updated and the bed was super comfortable with nice linens. The hotel is in a good location. We could walk to many restaurants and attractions. The cable car to the wharf goes right by the front of the hotel and there are buses nearby. The park is right down the block and there is a Starbucks across the street. My only issue is the bathroom. It was small and had no place to put cosmetics or hair items. It was clean and updated though.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience to Be Repeated”
Reviews.Author: Elias M
Reviews.Content: Marriott, Union Square renderted first class service as expected, (but oftened flubbed) from a well regarded establishment . Best of all Marriot didn’t have labor issues (I don’t cross picket lines) playing out in the street like the Hyatt. We checked in at ten p.m. and the burger and fries from room service was worth every dime ($16) after our near-death-experience flight. The chocolate cake is a nice treat but it’s just that, a cupcake-sized treat. Downside, no fridge or microwave in the room. They also do not provide an in-room safe and the bellmen did not want to check our laptop. But I've had property stolen in hotels and insisted. I also tip rigorously and the attitude these guys displayed cost them a couple of folds. Special note: Fernando, the doorman/valet went above and beyond to: get us a cab (on a Friday night), provide directions, and even found us a car when every other rental joint was “sold out.” If you stay here seek him out. Reward good service with a good tip.

Reviews.Title: “great location, room above average”
Reviews.Author: bryli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally one block away from Union Square; a short walk to plenty of shopping and restaurants, Nob Hill, Chinatown, etc. The hotel was renovated not too long ago, a big plus. The lobby has pillars in the check-in/out area that make it a bit awkward when trying to line up. The room was a bit on the compact side, but clean and modern. Same about the bathroom, except it was lacking counter space. Overall a great hotel to stay at for a vacation and to sight-see San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaEncinitas
Reviews.Content: Came for business meeting @ Moscone, but wanted quieter location near Union Square & weren't disappointed. Staff was very friendly & Nan at front desk helpful to let us check in early. Felt more like a botique hotel. Concierge room got us lounge access & were given room upgrade with view of Bay. Although room & bathroom are on the small side, the view more than made up for it & bed is probably the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel. Easy to walk to best shops & restaurants or to BART for anything else you could want. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: travelerone_11
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient to cable cars, union square, other hotels. We had an upgrade to a mini suite which was a very generous size room with a great view toward Knob Hill and the Bay. An oversize room with bath called a mini suite. Staff was very helpful and accomodating. The lobby is small and can get crowded. The lounge and restraurant are only adequate but the location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice for A Stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for multiple nights recently with my family. It has a great location at Union Square. A starbucks is right across the street. There is obviously a ton of restaurants, bars and shopping nearby. It is a very close walk to Chinatown and not too bad to get to North Beach. The hotel is pretty modern and clean. We had a very large room with two beds. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed. We had a nice view out of one of the windows. Although we were high up, we actually heard a good amount of noise from the street below at night. The concierge lounge is large with pretty good selections. The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious & clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just under a week to visit a conference in the moscone center. The best thing about the hotel is it's location right in the center of San Francisco. The hotel is located one street behind union square and about 5 blocks from the moscone (I liked to walk over there so no issue for me). The rooms are clean spacious and quiet. I didn't hear any street noise (I had a room on the 11th floor). The one thing I did miss in the room was a safe. Apart from that everything was there including free wifi. There's a nice bar / dining area at the ground floor where you can also just hang-out with a view on the street. I would have no problem coming here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: ATXtrvller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Union Square Hotel a few years ago when it was undergoing renovations as Hotel 480 and was much more impressed during that stay. While my friend and I did deal with a few hiccups as a direct result of the renovations back then, overall, the room was nice and spacious, with little noise from the street. This time, however, was different. Instead of the double queen room I occupied on my previous stay, my wife and I stayed in a Single King Bed room with a view, and I felt like the room was much smaller than I anticipated. It served its purpose to give us a nice room to sleep and keep our stuff in, but everything was tight and cramped. I had to get dressed out of my suitcase in the closet, because my wife used the ottoman on the side of the bed to hold her suitcase, and the dresser drawers were way too small to hold a week's worth of clothes. I was pretty disappointed, because I was expecting a much larger room with the price I paid and the memory of the spacious double bed room. The sink in the bathroom was small with very little counter space, as noted in other reviews on here. We could also hear our neighbors in the next room when they were coming and going and also when they were talking at a normal volume in their room. We could hear a baby crying from a room somewhere around us as well. I can understand a little noise from neighboring rooms in a hotel, but this seemed a little loud. Oh, and while I planned on using the Stockton-Sutter Garage across the street for our rental car the last 2 nights of our stay, I ended up having to use the Marriott parking garage at $48/night, because the other garage was closed by the time we got back to the hotel. I also had to pay $12.95 for internet each day, which is a ripoff to me. While many hotels are still charging for internet, I think it is ridiculous and policies need to be changed. The good: nice, updated place with good customer service and friendly employees. However, I don't think those few good things are enough for me to come back. I think I will try a different hotel next time we visit San Francisco. While this hotel IS right in the middle of Union Square, providing easy access to most activities, I think I can find something better for my money next time around. We didn't spend TOO much time directly in Union Square anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent room service”
Reviews.Author: shuan
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 nights last year. The room is very clean and the bed is very comfortable. The room service is excellen. No matter how dirty or messy I left the room in the morning, we was always welcomed by a clean and nice room at night. The location is very convenient too, it close to few big shopping mall. You can easily access alot of places by the cable car which just at the junction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean Rooms - Strong Rec!”
Reviews.Author: BornaTravelinMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at San Fran Marriott for 4 nights with children - quick trip to San Fran. The location is a 10 - unbeatable. No, this property is not a Ritz Carlton or 5 star luxury property, but the lobby appears new, the rooms are very clean and adequate (bathroom a bit small), wireless internet worked flawless. Given the location and price, I give this a 5 star. However, if you are looking to spend 400 plus, there are other options in San Fran. Under 200, I will pick this property 100% of the time. Restaurant ideas Chinese - Brandy Ho's (awesome) Pizza - Tony's Pizza Napoletana - Best I have ever had by a mile outside Italy - GO THERE! Vietnamese - Slanted Door at Pier 1 I think - amazing - make reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: encinocarol
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Union Square in San F rancisco. Our room was very well appointed as was the entire hotel. We found all the staff to be very helpful and courteous. We used the services of the concierge and were given good advice as to restaurants and attractions. This hotel is very centrally located. Leave your car in the garage and walk or use public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: thwong
Reviews.Content: After looking at many other hotels, we were pleased to find that we could have our 3 young children with us in the same room at this hotel. We found that many hotels in SF and other cities do not allow more than 4 in a room. In view that there were 5 of us, the front desk manager, Henry Wong was very kind to upgrade us to a more spacious junior suite on the 20th floor which could accomodate the 2 double beds and the rollaway bed comfortably. There was even enough space for an armchair and leg rest at the window area. We took a bay view corner room package and cd see a bit of the Bay in between the tall buildigs. But SF was generally foggy thruout our stay. The room was bright with large bay windows and with a contemporary modern decor. We found the room and bathroom clean and very comfortable. There was a gourmet coffee maker too. The vanity in the bathroom was rather small which made it a bit difficult to place our things by the sink. Other than that we were very pleased with the room. There's buffet breakfast downstairs which is reasonably priced. We found the location very convenient. The hotel is right at the cable car stop, across from two 24hr diners - Sear's fine foods and Lori's diner, across from walgreens, around the corner to Union square, chinatown, Macy's, Apple Store, boutiques and other shops. We walked down to market street to take the F tram to Fisherman's wharf and used the $2 ticket to transfer onto a bus from Ghiradelli square back to Union square! So cheap, saw lots of San Francisco and easy to get around from this hotel. Not so far up the hill so, no need to climb hills. Parking is steep but can park next door at the parking garage for less. The hotel staff are fantastic and a special thanks to Henry & Perry!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, and Early Mornings"”
Reviews.Author: DV8TION
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Francisco Union Square Marriott from August 31-September 2 for the Salesforce.com (Dreamforce 2011) conference. The hotel is conveniently located near great shopping, restaurants, and the Moscone Center. My only interaction with the Marriott team was with the front desk and concierge all of which were great experiences! My room was on the 7th floor (708) facing Sutter Street. My only recommendation if you stay at this Marriott property is to request a room opposite Sutter Street if possible. The early morning street noise is the worst I have ever experienced. The garbage trucks started each morning between 4:30-5:00AM and then the delivery trucks for the hotel across the street. I have never experienced street noise at a hotel like I did this last week. I don’t blame the Marriott at all and in hind sight I should have requested a different room. The challenge was that with 45,000 people plus attending the Dreamforce conference, rooms were quite scarce.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gailfromhome
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here on a quick anniversary trip to San Francisco, and enjoyed every minute. We were upgraded to a suite (how can you not love a hotel that does that?) It was a great choice -- right in the center of the city, a block or two from Union Square, so if you're a walker you can pretty much walk everywhere. Our suite had floor to ceiling windows looking out over the city, extremely comfortable beds and an elegant bathroom. The hotel decor is very 21st century modern, with comfortable areas to sit in the lobby, opening into a sports bar and then to a lounge with comfortable places to sit and order bar food. We attempted to go across the street to Starbucks for a quick breakfast, but it was crowded and we ended up back in the hotel -- very glad we did. The buffet breakfast is excellent. Service was impeccable and friendly. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: troy2018
Reviews.Content: Much more of a business hotel, but it worked perfectly for my first trip to San Francisco. It's right in the middle of Union Square, which is close to Chinatown, North Beach, and is walkable to Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are small, but the beds are nice. If you don't plan on spending much time in the hotel, but want a central and clean location, this is a good choice. The staff were very accommodating as well with early check-in and late check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: fearlesschickgoforth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is your typical chain hotel. The rooms are clean and acceptable and the hotel feels safe. It's a block from Union Square. There's easy access to the Powell Streetcar. The hotel has a lounge. But overall it's a chain hotel and lacks pizazz. Our room was small-ish. We could hear all the activity outside the door. Housekeeping came knocking before 8:30 am. The bed was comfortable. The room looked out on a zen garden which was the rooftop of the building next door. It was a nice touch, especially if one doesn't get a view of the city. My personal pet peeves: Wireless is ridiculously expensive and there are no shower caps in the bathrooms. The hotel is a good, safe bet -- especially if you can get a good deal with an online discounter.

Reviews.Title: “No Rest for the Weary”
Reviews.Author: Kathy J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a busy intersection, and the rooms do not have good soundproofing. Honking horns woke me up at midnight, and garbage trucks woke me up at 5 a.m. After 5 a.m., the traffic noise kept me from getting back to sleep. The bathroom is tiny -- one sink and the counter is barely large enough to go around the sink. The sink is crammed up next to the tub/shower. The bathtub was peeling. There are several comparably priced hotels in the area that are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: txjmorr
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. It must have been redone recently or it looks like it. We were in rooms 704-705 (1 King and 2 doubles) No connecting doors, but we were at the end of a hall right next too each other. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The showers and sinks had the most water pressure of any hotel we have ever stayed. (Of course the shower head was too short for me at 6’4” but most are.) The bathroom did not have a lot of counter space. I am not a fan of paying for internet (12.95 a day) but it is for 24 hours from the time you log in, not till noon the next day. Beds were great. Great location to everything in SF. You are right on the trolley line. The only thing that is very bizarre is the closet in 705. It has two sliding doors and when you slide either panel to access the closet, you only get an opening that is less than 1 foot. Totally unacceptable. Really wasted space. They need a swing door on this closet. We booked thru Priceline so I can not tell you room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsFuntraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved this immaculately clean hotel, with incredible staff who treat you like royalty! Perect location with a great cable car stop right outside, Starbucks on the corner, great restaurants all around, wonderful shopping and cheap taxi ride to the wharf and Ghiradelli. Beds were wonderful and we wish we had a shower like theirs at our house. Try "Sears Fine Food" next door for a terrific breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: Newly remodeled property on the edge of china town, 10 minute walk to north beach. Rooms are tight but well appointed. Concierge lounge is spacious and offers a nice assortment of snacks. Overall the staff was great, not your typical corporate Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, several blocks from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Deckwalker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and concierge lounge had great view. The only negative and it is a small one is walking to Union Square is straight down -or up depending on coming or going- several blocks BUT trolley goes right by hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT ROOM... A GREAT PLACE TO STAY...”
Reviews.Author: TCovington
Reviews.Content: The room is beautiful... just like it's pictured on the website. Staff was professional and interactive. The restaurant/lounge on the lobby floor is delicious! Tom was delightful in the bar... gracious, helpful... order the way you want it! We were close to everything... Hotel was recently renovated. There were lots of outlets and garbage cans in the room. The room hosted a small bar for coffee and tea. The shower and the bed were wonderful. Lots of pillows and a great bedding. There was a whole strip of outlets for your electronics and curling irons! The room has one very large window with two smaller side windows. One window opens in case you wish to hear the trolley cars and sea gulls. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap prices that don't equate with a cheap experience”
Reviews.Author: DessertHounds
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, we are all looking for value in downtown hotels, and this Marriott goes above and beyond. The rooms are what one would expect from a Marriott, clean, comfortable. The rooms are rather large for San Francisco. The location is right at Sutter and Powell, there is a doorman for cabs, and there is a bar/lounge in the lobby. It still maintains a rather quiet feel as compared to some of the other larger chains on Union Square. I was very surprised at how impressed I was with this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott uses Priceline? Great Surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelwithkidz
Reviews.Content: Got a fantastic deal during SF Marathon weekend $150.00! The entire staff was fantastic! They even clapped and said 'Congratulations!' when we came back from the race :-) Love those rain showerheads! And Marriott beds-WOW! In the past when using other 31/2 + stars hotels from Priceline-we have gotten what I call the 'Priceline treatment,' = rude check in, SUPER small, noisy, worst location rooms and don't even bother requesting early/late check in, check out treatment. Marriott treated us like the 20 year +rewards members that we are without knowing it! Marriott always = fantastic beds, service and clean rooms, great smelling soaps, shampoos (it's a girl thing) compfy pillows&beds.

Reviews.Title: “Brandnew feeling with easy access to downtown SanFran”
Reviews.Author: orangeyellow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights before we flied back to LA. The room is so clean like brandnew. The location is super since not only that it's right next to the San Fran's famous cable car, it also has extensive access to all the convenience that downtown San Fran has. We had a dinner right next door called Louis Dinner whose food was very yummy with a funky feel. My son played with the old coin record player right next to each dining table. They love Michael Jackson's songs!!! The front desk people are very efficient. We enjoyed this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: ShastaCoGal920
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. I am a Marriot's Reward member and I can honestly say this is the very best Marriot experience that I have ever had, from the hotel itself to the staff! Everything was excellent! I will stay there again my next trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “rude reception team and no free wifi in this 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: edany
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great....... very centrally located and just close to everything. The room is a standard mariott comfortable one...... i hope that one day they get convinced that WIFI is no more a luxury that you have to pay for it! Its true that you can access the business center for using the internet for free but this is not enough when you have to work on your laptop. By the way, i had to pay for my internet for 2 days before i discovered by chance that they have a business center with internet....... i had to believe that i was mislead to pay for the internet. One last thing, the reception team during my stay was very rude for a 4 stars hotel....... they dont hesitate to show you that they are working on launching a rocket to the moon and they are not available now ! very unhelpful! I hope that by now they have changed this team.

Reviews.Title: “In hustle and bustle of San Francisco, super fun.”
Reviews.Author: beasttraveler
Reviews.Content: A short walk to so much shopping (Westfield complex is pretty much next door) and Yerba Buena Gardens (so much stuff for everyone, and for us, kids too was an exceedingly convenient bonus), and Market Street of course. There was a bustling lobby, sometimes hectic, a second floor reserved for seminars or receptions---but empty every time we were up there, and as it was carpeted and spacious turned out to be a great place for two toddlers to run and tumble around safely----and the old school connecting room doors came in handy to visit with family in the adjoining room, making it seem like a party. Check-in line was pretty long and slow, front reception was professional, if a bit aloof. In their defense, they were slammed. The Starbucks line in the lobby is often dauntingly long and slow as well. A few Starbucks within spitting distance though. It's weird how the front doors blow wind in directly into the main sitting area, rather poor layout.

Reviews.Title: “The best location and very helpful and friendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Johan1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with my wife and two children ( 18 & 19 y ). Located really in the city center. Nice and comfortable rooms. Very clean... which is MOST important for us. Breakfast was good, even though not the best on a Marriott in the US. Very helpful front desk staff, when trying to make airflight check-in online. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: grevic
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great. Helped us with the locaton of restaurants we wanted to visit. They also had a guest laundry, the only cost being the purchase of washing powder. find this really essential when you are travelling for a number of weeks to keep cost down when you have a lot of washing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jcosca
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Very clean, centrally located and all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: rmsteiner
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Fabulous and helpful staff. Loved the location!

Reviews.Title: “Our 40th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: 40Anniversarytravelr
Reviews.Content: After much; searching online for that perfect hotel in San Francisco, we finally chose this one and were SO Glad we did! This was our first time in San Francisco, and the location was perfect. The wonderful staff greeted us with a bottle of Napa Valley Champagne to celebrate our 40th Anniversary, along with a very thoughtful card signed by the staff. The room was very nice, spacious, very clean. They have a very comfortable bed. We had a beautiful view of the bay. You are in the center of everything here, with restaurants , shopping, cable cars right around the corner. Just loved this hotel. Thank you for making our Anniversary So Special! Would love to come back

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I love Marriott hotels and this one was a very good choice. Location is right near the middle of the action at the corner or Sutter and Powell. The famous cable car is just right the corner in order to bring you to Fisherman Wharf's. Rooms are small but very clean with all the amenities and the hotel is in perfect condition. We used the breakfast buffet one morning and the food was good but a bit expensive. Choices of restaurants are plenty with only a short walk. The only negative side is the very expensive parking fees of 48$/day + taxes, specially when you have others options 1-2 blocks away at 20$/day cheaper and you have to call valet at least 20-30 minutes before you need your car or you will wait. Valet is the only option, you can't self park. Try the Stockon garage at the corner of Sutter/Stockton to save money for the parking fees. The rest of the stay was fabulous. Great service, great staff. We will come back to this one and use a different parking!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: johnhuhlee
Reviews.Content: Like all the hotels located in Union Square, this is just as nice as the Hyatt and St. Francis. Rooms were nice and clean, as well as the gym. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mckenzi
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, everything you can expect from Marriott! The location is fabulous, right next to the Cable Car stop. Love San Fransisco and the Marriott Union Square!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, great location”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: Great location on Union Square (but no noise). Received a very large (except for the bathroom) and well appointed room on a high floor with a nice view. Service was great from doorman to front desk to concierge lounge. A great downtown Marriott. If you're driving an will use your car during the day park at 444 Stockton Street ($8/night evening rate!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Gadabouts95
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our holiday - a drive along Highway 1. Check-in was quick and our bags appeared just a couple of minutes after we reached our room. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location could not be better, just a step away from Union Square and Chinatown. As we arrived mid afternoon following a long flight we decided to take advantage of the happy hour in Bin480, the hotel's bar. Great value, we shared a tasty prosciutto, artichoke heart and brie pizza and drinks prices were also good. Service could not be faulted in spite of the bar being quite busy. The hotel was quiet and we received a really good rate for our large and comfortable room with a view of Union Square. Checkout was also efficient via the TV, just leaving the key in the room. We would certainly stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “When you look up "average" in the dictionary there's a photo of this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: I'm not the world's biggest Marriott fan. I admit that. Call me crazy but when I go to a city as vibrant as San Francisco I'd like my hotel to reflect a little of the local flavor. This is a dressed up Crowne Plaza and there's no mistaking that. There's a review further down with the title "Solid Marriott Experience" and I would say that's probably the best description of this hotel. Faint praise. I wouldn't book this hotel but was attending a meeting there so had no choice. The good: Location. Comfortable beds. The not-so-great: You could be in Missouri for all you'd know (all due respect to Missouri). Lackluster service and check-in Room service food neither tasty not reasonable for the quality. Jeez people - this is SF at least the bread should be fresh and delicious. Noisy - pack earplugs. Charging $12.95 for internet access when if your room is properly situated you can grab the Kimpton's free internet from across the street. There was nothing egregious about this hotel but the city is full of interesting gems. Find one.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: 3msmomHI
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in an awesome Union Square location. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby! Spent 3 nights here with some girlfriends and would definitely return. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. We were able to check in early since we came in on a red eye flight. They were also able to answer questions about different modes of transportation and directions to different locations. The lobby is nice and modern. The rooms are a good size and the beds are comfy! The cable car stop was near the entrance of the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “My room was great, under-whelming welcome”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: I arrived late night after a long flight and was completely exhausted. There were actually 2 people at the front desk, I'm sure they were night staff and it was clear that checking in guests was not their core responsibility. They were busily keying away at numbers on the computer, one was helping the other. I stood and waited while neither of them greeted me. When they finished with the problem, one walked away, without looking up -without acknowledging that I was there and went to another station and stared working. I was almost about to laugh.. or ask if I should come back at a better time.. when one of the staff looked at her colleague and said (not to me.. ) can you take care of this? (and nodded her head towards me) only then did he look up and acknowledge that I was there. For a minute I thought I was on candid camera. I got checked in and the rest of my stay was fine. The $30.00 room service oatmeal is not quite as good as the $4.00 oatmeal from Starbucks across the street (just a tip) My room was extra large and very comfortable and clean - everything else about the stay was great - fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DMHMaryland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 35 yr old son, we had two rooms - A junior suite and double room. The rooms, service, location, view were all wonderful - Lovely rooms! No complaints at all in this area. But, the complaints I do have are: 1) For the HIGH price of this hotel - There were no refridgerators in our rooms. 2) Breakfast was not included in the room rate and 3) We had to pay to use the computers in the business center. I knew this before booking the rooms, so, I stayed here entirely for location. So, you need to keep this in mind when booking here - If it's location you want, this is the place. Not good for family with children, little or teenagers (teens like to stay on the computer!). I just think it's a shame that at lower cost Marriott Hotels, (such as Residence Inn), you pay less, have great rooms, with an all inclusive package. But, here - You pay hefty, get great location....just don't expect all the added Marriott perks - Not here. So, no complaints with the rooms or service - All was fantastic and served the purpose of this trip. But, on routine vacations - we will surely stay at one of the more economical Marriotts. Also, they did not have connecting rooms, but they did manage to place us in rooms off the main hallway, in a cul de sac type of setting - private, with a door separating from main hallway. This was very nice. DH

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, generously sized room, large windows, lots of light.”
Reviews.Author: yuditka
Reviews.Content: We love the central location, the friendly staff, the colorful appointments (cheerful), the light-filled room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: JustCruisin11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely re-done and is wonderful. It was once the Crowne Plaza and smelled like a greasy restaurant, but it is now a modern, stylish hotel with a staff that makes you feel welcome and safe. Our room on the 16th floor had a good view of Nob Hill and was spotlessly clean. Both the room and the bathroom were large and well stocked. The hotel is centrally located on the Market/Powell cable car line, and is one block from Union Square. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best beds in the world!”
Reviews.Author: dt200
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 great nights here. The room was a little small but very comfortable and spotless, and the beds!!!!They were extremely comfortable. Best sleeps I had in the USA and rest of family concurr.Ensuites very modern and also spotless. Internet cost about $12.50 per day which I thought was a bit much.
