It’s also very conveniently located near public transportation. The Powell BART station is four blocks south. I always schlep my luggage from the station, which can be a little tricky given the crowds in Union Square. So, folks with bulkier baggage may wish to catch a cab. Once there, it is however super easy, fast and cheap to take BART to SFO. I did unfortunately find the walls to be thin and subsequently the room during my second stay was noisy. There was loud door/drawer slamming/banging going on the first night of my second stay which awakened me early in the morning. A call to the front desk put a stop to that, but there was still significant noise transfer to a lesser degree throughout my stay. Given that, I would be inclined to try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: dnolan36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mainly because of its location and the deal we got on the room. It is nice that it is located directly on the cable car route. The service and all the employees were very nice and courteous. The room that we had was nice and cozy. The room we had was more on the small side. It made good use of the space but it could have been a bit bigger for the price. The bed in the room is one of the most comfortable I have had for a hotel. There were a few negatives to this hotel. When we were there the hotel bar was being remodeled. A few times I wanted to go down to have a drink but I could not because the bar was closed. The second problem was the bathroom was very small. There is no way that two people could get ready or go in the bathroom at the same time. My last complaint is that the internet is not free. For what it cost to stay in hotels of this class I would like to have free internet. I think the internet was around $12.00 a day which is a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Martex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights at the end of May. The hotel is branded as a Marriott but it is not operating at full power yet. The bar and lounge area is still being renovated and in my view will be hard pushed to be completed by the end of June but then I am no expert. Check in staff we found to be efficient and pleasant enough and the concierge were always keen to assist. The rooms have been renovated but like other reviewers we found the bathroom to be on the basic side for a Marriott. We didn't use the restaurant as it was expensive for our budget but there are plenty of places to eat within minutes of the hotel. Location is excellent. We arrived from San Francisco Airport via BART; got off at Powell Street and it's a straight 10 minute walk up to the corner of Sutter Street and the hotel. There is a Starbucks on one corner, a Walgreens on another and a diner. Also you are only a few minutes away from all the main attractions around Union Square. Overall this is an excellent hotel offering good standards for the money. Once the bar and lounge areas are complete this will improve still further. This was our fourth trip to San Francisco and we would certainly stay in the Marriott Union Square again. If it is your first time in the city this hotel would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Should improve when renovations are completed in June”
Reviews.Author: FancyNancyBoston
Reviews.Content: We knew from reviews that the lobby was undergoing renovations, but there was no business center or bar or comfortable lounging area. None of this was highlighted by the hotel on booking with Marriott. We selected the hotel for its location - perfect to get almost anywhere via cable car, BART, bus or walking and it was a Marriott property. Had originally booked the Stanford Court on Nob Hill but needed to cancel due to a knee injury (too much climbing with a bum knee). Desk staff and bell men were pleasant and helpful. We avoided the concierge because of previous reviews, as well as floors 6 through 8 (noisy). My husband used the fitness center and found it very adequate. Guest rooms are newly updated and a bit sterile, but not unpleasant. All the comments about the size of the bathrooms are right on. Smallest bath since Paris I think. I thought the price was very reasonable for downtown SF, probably more so during the renovations. A Walgreen's across the street provided snacks & other essentials - clearly geared to the foreign tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms and common areas”
Reviews.Author: DrJJBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: Very nice, newly renovated hotel with style of renovation similar to Marriott Renaissance Hotel Brand. Excellent front desk and housekeeping services. Great location just north of Union Square on Powell, right on cable car line. Bathrooms a bit small, but well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JustMeTexas
Reviews.Content: AWESOME location for someone visiting for the first time! We picked this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor and we were extremely satisfied. We were within walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go (we like to walk). If this is your first visit to San Francisco, DON'T RENT A CAR. You will not need it. I also recommend taking a guided bus tour your first day so you can decide where you want to go back and spend more time at. We LOVED the shopping in Chinatown! We're already planning a return trip for November because 5 nights was not enough for us. I see a lot of comments on the front desk and i can say personally, I was neither impressed or disappointed with them. The gentlemen at the Bell Desk were very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, unfriendly Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Summer717
Reviews.Content: I agree with another review who wrote that the lady at the Concierge is quite unpleasant. She wasn't as rude as what the other review described, but I can easily imagine her being like that. The "keys" on her uniform is le Clef d'Or. (the Golden Key) And a Concierge would have to go through several trainings to obtain it and if a staff is wearing it, they better be good! On Les Clefs d'Or USA website they state: "The crossed gold keys on our members’ lapels are the international symbol of our organization and an assurance that you are dealing with an experienced concierge dedicated to providing the highest quality of service to all. Our members, through their extensive networking, are able to provide the ultimate in service to their guests. Les Clefs d’Or concierges continually educate themselves through daily encounters and experiences in their home cities and countries. These concierges broaden and enhance their knowledge, understanding and contacts worldwide, all in an effort to provide the best possible service to guests while providing added value to their hotels. " The Concierge lady was anything but what they describe. I asked her for a few pet shop locations in San Francisco, and after googling, she told me "there's only 1". ONE?! In the whole of San Francisco?? (earlier I had gone to Front Desk for the same question as the Concierge was not there, and the Front Desk told me after doing a bit of searching that there is none!) I went to that one pet shop she gave me, and asked the shop if SF doesn't have many pet stores and she told me there are lots! When I went to the Concierge lady for some information, while googling for it, the phone rang and she picked it up. She was still in the midst of helping me, but instead of telling the guest she will call right back, she kept on talking to the other guest, while turning her computer screen to me, and pointing to the info. My goodness, what is that for professionalism..... Maybe I should just write to the GM to inform him of her very poor service. I used to be a hotelier at a major 5 star hotel chain too, and I can say that the attitude of the Concierge is unacceptable. The bellstaff were probably the most helpful and pleasant during our 5 nights of stay. The location however is excellent being just steps away from Union Square. Although the hotel gives you a feeling of a simple Holiday Inn kind of hotel (in other words, not luxurious), it is newly renovated thus clean. The bathroom is tiny but at least it's new. Strange they provide soap, but no soap dish though. Housekeeping is not the best, as they only changed the bathtowels and sheets, but clearly did not vacuum or clean the bathroom floor as during the 6 days there, dust started pile up in the corners. So at one glance it looks cleaned, but not thoroughly. I stayed here only because it was very newly renovated, but I can easily imagine the hotel will start to wear out in just a few years time.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Full-Service Marriott, but ...”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay. Very pleasant, low-key, quiet, boutique-like. ROOM: New and spiffy, "Compact" bathroom didn't bother me. Most glaring omission: NO SAFE in a brand-new Marriott: unforgivable and unbelievable. Flat-panel TV with analog signal; why don't you make the internet connection dial-up to go along with the fuzzy TV picture. By the way, no HBO, but STARZ, which turned out to be FOX Business Channel. Note to management: give us real coffee mugs instead of WASTEFUL paper cups in the room! CONCIERGE LOUNGE: very nice, roomy, high quality food but limited selections consistent with recent downgrades across the country. Closed Saturday, reopened Sunday late afternoon. GYM: new Life Fitness treadmills (6) , striders (3), and bikes (3); all with TV's. A water fountain (instead of the current dispenser) would save all the throwaway cups. Aren't you Californians suppose to be more environmentally-aware? LOCATION: probably the best feature. Close to most tourist traps (cable cars, shopping, Chinatown)

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: angelinem1
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday evening, gave the car to valet, and began a fantastic weekend. I asked the front desk clerk, Andres, for a room facing Coit Tower and was rewarded with a wonderful corner room on the 19th floor with a view of the Bay and the Powell Street hill so we could see the cable cars going up and down. The hotel is small, has no bar which would be a wonderful asset, but hey, there are great bars and restaurants within steps of the hotel which is corner of Powell and Sutter. Only real minus are the very small bathrooms with little counter space for toiletries, but we made it work. Service was superb overall. Hotel newly renovated so the rooms are clean and well appointed. We asked for a late check out Sunday morning and were given until 2 P.M. so we were able to go down to the Ferry Building for a wonderful breakfast and some shopping in the indoor Ferry Building marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “First Review of complete Renovation- Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: HOTEL REVIEW # 170 Marriott Union Square MY TRAVEL STYLE: If possible, I try to stay away from business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the “wow” experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name). LOCATION: Excellent. A few blocks from the shopping of Union Square and the nightlife on Geary street. TYPE OF ROOM: Standard Room. BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Excellent bed, high quality linens, and perfect down pillows. LIGHTING: Good lighting in bedroom and bathroom. BATHROOM/SHOWER: This is the downside of the room. The bathroom is tiny and there is barely room to put a toiletry bag. They did a good job with the space but it is so small. The shower has good water pressure and can be made consistently hot if desired. TOILETRIES: Bed & Bath products…. Very good. CLEANLINESS: Hotel is 3 days old and very clean. A/C: Didn’t use CLOSET SPACE: Average size, but may be too small for 2 people to unpack all items. STYLE OF ROOM: Very comfortable room and some nice style. COMMON AREA: Lobby is small and not really a place to hang out. Looks like a hip boutique hotel as opposed to a Marriott. QUIET/MORNING LIGHT: Room was exceptionally quiet but could hear a loud car go by occasionally. Definitely worth getting a high floor for less street noise. FOOD: Room service food quality was mediocre. TV/INTERNET: TV has many channels. Internet is available for $12.95 SERVICE: Staff are nice. One person sent me the wrong direction making me late for a meeting in the city. SUMMARY:Definitely one of the best Marriott experiences since it is brand new, looks less like a Marriott and more like a boutique hotel. I have also stayed at the W and the Monaco, and this will be my top choice now in the $200 hotel range. If you are ok with a tiny bathroom, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is changing to a Marriott on April 1 2009- Needs some fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights at Hotel 480. The first and most important thing to know is that the lobby and front door area is under construction. This was not a big deal for me as I only spent about 30 seconds in those areas each day. As it was under construction we got a great deal, (94.00 per night - expedia). The construction work is only done through the day, so for most people that is not a proplem unless you are a very late sleeper. The rooms are very nice, appears to be almost all new carpet, furniture and fixtures. Our room had two proplems. The first was that even though we were on the 19th floor there are no window curtains on the floor to ceiling windows in the bathroom. Not a big deal until the workers/window washers come by (they did, then a mad dash to become fully dressed). Really the hotel should have some sort of curtains or covering, a person with a good telescope in another building could be getting a good show. The other issue is the old story of chasing the hot water in the morning. I thought all hotels had beaten this proplem. The showers in the morning were an ongoing problem each day we were there. Ranged from very cold to too hot, with a few moments of just right thrown in. Perhaps being on the 19th floor had a bearing, but it should not be so. The hotel has to work on this if it wants to attact the business crowd, end of story! The staff were OK, not great, not bad, cleaning staff missed a couple of things during the stay, but when spoken to it was fixed. We took the advice of another on this site and asked for a corner unit on a upper floor, good advice in regards to traffic and outside noise, (it is downtown after all), The corner unit gives you a 2nd door to close that will keep hallway noise from invading your room. (Weekends guests seem to make more noise) The only proplem with ours was that we were locked in our small hallway until I pried it open, the hardware on the frame was missing, not a big deal until there is a fire and you want to leave quickly!! Once again, Marriiott is a big company and I am sure that they will fix most of these issues. Overall it is clean and well appointed and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: KainaluHi
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews my husband booked a room here over another hotel he stayed at previously. I can't believe the clean, stylish rooms at the room rate we paid. There is still renovations going on in the lobby and exterior, probably the reason for the low room rate. But this was definitely the best by for our $. Hopefully the roomrates are still affordable on our next trip back to SF. Walgreens, Diner and Starbucks right across the street. Right on the cable car run. Great staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JoVNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 25-Feb-2009 to 4-Mar-2009 and would like to highlight the excellent customer service we received from all the staff but especially Diana (front-desk), James (bellman) and the 2 concierges. We also had reservations at the J W Marriott but at the last minute based on reviews at this site decided to make reservations here instead. Yes, the hotel was still undergoing some renovations but we were not inconvenienced by it. The service, the large room, comfortable beds and location more than made up for it. I was travelling with my 73-year-old Mother and was worried beforehand about the how far the hotel was to the shopping area but in the end she found the short walk a breeze and was making several trips back to the hotel a day to unload her shopping bags. I also used the fitness center everyday and it was more than adequate. The TV screen on each cardio machine made my workout more enjoyable. Jo NZ

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location with brand new rooms and friendlt staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeStanton
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after reading reports on here. We wanted a centrally located hotel reasonably priced with a nice room with a view. We got more than expected! We arrived at the Hotel 480 after our ten hour flight to a clean but rather dated lobby, the concierge explaned that the 'new' lobby was next door under wraps and they would be moving there in the next few days, something that happened during our stay. We were shown to our room on the 21st floor. The room was of a good size, brand new, totally refurbished it smelled of new carpet and fresh plaster! The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was classy with marble tops and once again all new bath/shower wc. The 32' flat screen TV had 30 something channels including the all important weather channel. On to the Location. The hotel 480 sits convienently on the corner of Sutter and Powell, where the cable car,(like a tram but pulled by an underground cable) runs right outside! to both Union square (1 block) and the Westfield shopping mall one way and the other way to Fishermans Wharf. Also various buses run along Sutter and Geary (1 block away). There is a drug store on the opposite corner and Loris Diner. The only negatives were that due to the renovations the bar and restaurant had to close whilst we were there to be relocated with the new lobby. Room service during this time was only available for Breakfast. This for us this was a minor inconvience as there were plenty of places to eat/drink within a few minutes walk. I also tried the gym which had all new life fitness machines! We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: atlanticbiodiesel
Reviews.Content: The manager Chris was just not nice. Granted we did need to make changes to our reservation but his accommodation to us for the fact that we booked it through hotels.com instead of through their reservation system he made us go through multiple loop holes and over two hours on the phone to get resolved. Unbelieveable. No customer service what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The 480!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelSacramento
Reviews.Content: If you have read the earlier reviews I can tell you that everyone was dead on about the 480. The 480 is located at "480" Sutter Street. Very easy to remember where your hotel is when the name of the hotel is where the hotel is. Brought the family to S.F. for the Chinese New Year Parade and festivities. We were only 1 block from the parade and of course very close to all of the festivities. I liked everything about our room. The beds were very comfortable. There was a nice, thick comfy bedspread with 4 pillows on each bed. We had a flat screen tv but didn't really have much time to watch it. There is a nice alcove that holds a small coffee pot for coffee/tea. The headboard has two reading lights as mentioned below. The colors/decorating were very nice. The bathroom has a light in the shower if you want to just have it on so as to not disburb other family members sleeping when showering. (The bathroom has a frosted glass sliding door so I was concerned the light might be too bright). We were unsure as to where the parking garage was for the hotel and ended up parking in another lot which I understand was quite a bit less expensive. We ran into the cleaning lady in the hall in the morning and she was very nice. The bellmen/doormen were very nice, friendly and helpful. The next time we come back to S.F. we will definetely stay at the 480. And this time it will be longer than just one night. Kudos 480 for a very nice job on the renovation and for the friendly and helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: liljro
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with two beds but when we checked-in they had none available so they upgraded us to a Jr. Suite which was sweet. The rooms are big & nice especially the bathroom. The hotel smells brand new but the only problem was the exterior of the hotel which is undergoing construction. We did not hear any construction; this is a great place plus it's located near Union Square. We will definately stay there again but beware the parking is $46 per day however, there is a parking garage right next to it which is cheaper for only $30. I would recommend to park there instead.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem! It is now on my favorite list.”
Reviews.Author: lvtravelngirl
Reviews.Content: I was first attracted to this hotel because it was in my price range; I heard SF was very expensive so being my first time, I was happy to find a hotel until $150 a night (I actually got it for $110/night). From the minute I arrived, I could not have picked a better hotel! The staff was friendly. I arrived at 7:30 a.m. (well, before check in) but Chris had a room for me within minutes. And what a room it was!! The other desk clerk seemed friendly and the concierge, bell hops and doormen were AWESOME!!! They always had a warm greeting and a smile on their face; very accommodating and helpful! My room was AWESOME!!! It didn't have the best view, but it wasn't horrible either- I was in room 1203. It was great because it had it's own little alcove entrance. The room was pretty big (king bed) and I immediately fell in love with the colors and decor. The bathroom is tiny in size, but also liked how it was decorated. The water pressure was perfect!! Maybe even a bit too much for the faucet at the sink. The toiletries are from Bath & Body Works. I loved the headboard on the bed-- it had two little reading lights that gave just enough light to read, but not enough to disturb the person on the other side of the bed. They now have flat screen tvs in the rooms. There was a nice sitting area (chair/ottoman) near the bay window in my room. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! I don't think there is a better spot in the entire city. It is less than 100 ft from the Powell/Hyde trolley and has a Starbuck's on one corner and a Walgreen's on the other. There were a lot of dining options in any direction once you walked outside. As far as the renovation is concerned, the only thing I noticed is that the front (the facade) is covered and there is scaffolding at the entrance of the hotel. I never heard any construction noise (but.. I wasn't in my room during the day). I was not at all inconvenienced or troubled by the renovation-- I can't wait to go back when they are done to see what it's going to look like! A small, but sort of important note: The elevators were very quick! I never had to wait more than a few seconds. Very nice when you come back and all you want to do is go rest in your room. I have been in hotels that I have had to wait more than 10 minutes for an elevator. I was traveling on my own (single female) and always felt safe in the hotel and in the surrounding area. Again, it was great that the trolley stop was basically right outside the hotel entrance. Some travel tips if you go: 1. Get a Go San Francisco card! I saved over $50 on attractions- I paid $79 for a 3 day pass and did: Wine Country tour , biked the bridge to Sausalito , City Bus Tour, Wax Museum, and the Alcatraz tour. You can purchase online, in advance. 2. Grayline tours (and probably all tours): Definitely ask for a DETAILED description of the actual tour. I took two Grayline tours (they were on my GoCard) and neither one really matched the brochure description. The City Bus tour and the Wine Country Tour. 3. I was told not to miss going to Scoma's and Boudin's for lunch/dinner. Both places were ok, but not worth the $$. I had Fish and Chips at Scoma's (Sausalito)- $24- way overpriced and nothing special. To be fair to Boudin's, I did NOT have the chowder; I had Jumbo Shrimp and Chips ($24.95)- the shrimp was tasty but again, not worth the money. 4. Get a pass for the trolley, MUNI, cable car system-- very convenient instead of having to carry around change and/or money for the fares. A 3 day pass (which I bought at Walgreen's) was $18. 5. If you are looking for the Real World San Francisco house, it's at 953 Lombard (not on the crooked section-- it's between Leavenworth and Jones and.. it's a very steep walk back up to Hyde- where the crooked street begins!) Again, I cannot wait to go back so I can stay at Hotel 480 again. It seemed like they had a lot of return customers. Each time I spent more than 5 minutes in the lobby (waiting for shuttles/tour buses), people were constantly saying Hi to the employees using their first names. It reminded me a bit of Cheers- where everyone knew each others names. I had nothing but an amazing experience at Hotel 480 and highly recommend it! (Definitely check out the discount hotel sites- hotels.com, travelocity, etc. for a reasonable rate-- I was happy to get it for $110 a night, but feel it's worth at least $200-$250!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, totally woth the money”
Reviews.Author: lupus81
Reviews.Content: Staid with my family their for 3 nights. Great location in walking distance to Union Square. Cable Car stops right next to the hotel. Friendly staff, awesome room (just new renovated - formerly Crown Plaza) and suprisingly really silent. Have staid in lots of other SF hotels, like Hilton etc. - this was the best 4star hotel so far!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, affordable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Smelly_Sock
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel stay for 4 nights about 2 months ahead and got a really good deal through Travelocity for about 88$ per night. The hotel is being renovated, so you cant really see the facade. But, as soon as you enter, its perfect. It's beautifully maintained(everything is brand new). We checked in late at night and the staff was very courteous and helpful. Room service is not 24 hours, that's the only thing you need to watch out for. We asked for and got a room on the 19th floor- away from all the street noise, and with a pretty good view. We had a glimpse of the bay even. The higher floors have even better view but they were still under renovation. The bathroom was clean and housekeeping was excellent. There isn't a business center, but they do have a computer attached to a printer just for printing your boarding passes and checking in online - that's good enough! It's right at the corner of Powell and Sutter - on the cable car line. Getting in at this stop is much better than walking down to union square where the lines are too long. There is a Starbucks right opposite the hotel. Walgreen and Loris diner are right across the street. Everything you could need is a block away at most. I repeat myself, but the location was perfect! Sorry, we forgot to take pics of the room. The bathroom toiletries were from bath and body works. The reception can provide maps and directions to most of the places you would want to visit. Chinatown is just 2 blocks away. Union square is about a block away. I would recommend not driving and parking in SF as the costs are high and public transport is readily available. Most places are a cab drive away at most.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable room--Expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: Our single king room on the 8th floor was large, quiet, and comfortable with a coffee maker but no refrigerator. The room was clean and newly renovated. Bed and sheets were comfortable, but the towels were rough. We only stayed Saturday night, and heard zero construction noise. The room had a large desk and comfortable office chair, but the small light on one side did not provide adequate illumination. I thought the room rate of $134 plus tax was a bargain for the area, but parking was $46 plus $6 tax. The nearby Sutter Stockton garage ($33.50) is an option, especially for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LVfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 480 for 2 nights. Great location. The room was newly remodeled so everything was new and clean. The staff were nice and helpful. The couple things I wish were a coffee table and a refrigerator in a room. I would stay at this hotel again and totally recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement Night”
Reviews.Author: nathanSF
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of our engagement at Hotel 480 and the staff went out of their way to make it special. They helped me arrange to have champagne and roses waiting in the room. They gave us an amazing suite which was nicely furnished and had a beautiful view. The hotel was in a great location - about a block from Union Square. It was close to our restaurant and the theater district. I was extremely impressed with this hotel and the value. I live in San Francisco and hadn't heard of this hotel until I reserved a room online. For some reason, it seems to have slipped under the radar. Well, I saw pictures of the future upgrades which is going to make this hotel even better and I'm sure it is going to get noticed then. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: donkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms for a long weekend (#1105). Very quiet. Staff was helpful. Location was very convenient to the Union Square / Powell street shopping, Very good rate through Travelocity. Yes, you don't have full hotel restaurant options during the remodeling. We didn't miss it a bit with options in the area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mundane but good location”
Reviews.Author: rihoward
Reviews.Content: Really good location just 100m from Union Square and beside a cable car line. Apart from that the hotel is currently being renovated and this may help the hotel, but it is very mundane. Everything about it was avergae- check in, receptionist and the standard of the room. Would be nice to have in room tea or coffee facilities. If you are staying here, I would recommend asking for a room in a higher floor in order to have a decent view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: reuhl925
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, staff at door and front desk were very friendly. We were orginally given a room with 2 beds but we had booked a king room. They immediately sent someone up to take us and our luggage to a new room which had an amazing view! Excellent location, everything right there. Loris diner across the street was yummy! There is also a Walgreens across the street too...very handy! No complaints when we stayed! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Price good, average stay with poor front desk service though”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl7500
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently to SF and booked the 480 for a week because it had received some very good reviews on Trip Advisor and we got a good deal. The location is great, just a block off Union Square and along the Powell cable car line. We were first put in a renovated room on the 8th floor, facing Sutter and nearly on the corner with Powell. The room was a good size with a king bed, sitting area, great desk and flatscreen TV, and a nice sized bathroom (tub-shower combo). The bed was very comfortable too! The renovated rooms look like the new Marriott Courtyards - one of the staff members told us it may become a Courtyard at some point. Unfortunately, the street noise during the night (a Saturday) was awful. It sounded like the windows were wide open in our room. Honks weren't muffled at all, we could sing along to the music from loud cars, and we actually heard people's conversations from the street! I got up a few times to check the windows and make sure they were all closed - they were. We've stayed in many large cities and in many properties in and around Union Square and have never had this problem. I'm not sure if this issue will eventually be fixed with the renos - right now they're working on the facade of the building and it looks like the glass in the window is thin and only single pane? At any rate, the next morning - a Sunday - we headed down to the front desk to request a room change. The first woman we talked to was helpful and assured us that we could be moved but that they would like to wait until noon or so, when people would be checking out and rooms would be available. She mentioned that it would be good if we were ready to move (i.e., packed) when we came back. When we arrived at noon though - with our bags all packed - there was another woman behind the desk, an older asian lady. From the beginning she didn't appear to want to help us or even take the time to listen. We heard much "no", "I don't know", "we can't..." and one word answers with no explanation for the first few minutes of our conversation. All we wanted was a simple move to a quieter room, something that shouldn't have been a problem at all in a hotel as big as the 480 (and particularly on a Sunday, when many people are checking out). We weren't looking for a bigger room, a room with a view, or even necessarily a renovated room. Just something a little quieter! This could have been achieved by putting us on the other side of the building or perhaps even moving us up a few floors. From the attitude you would have thought we were asking for the moon and the stars though. We finally got her to agree that they would LIKELY be able to move us but we would have to leave our bags with the concierge and come back IN PERSON to check in a few hours - no guarantees. Needless to say this put a bit of a kink in our sightseeing plans for the day but at that point we were just happy we had made some headway with this woman. We were eventually moved - to a smaller room on the other side of the building a few floors up. The room had construction going on around it during the days (somewhat inconvenient, particularly when they started doing some glue-smelling tile work one morning at 4 AM). But it was quiet at night, which is what we were looking for. However, there was a complete lack of customer service and willingness to accommodate here. The only other time we've requested a move in a hotel - at the Grand Hyatt at DFW Airport - it happened within minutes and they came to our room and personally brought our luggage to the new room! So this experience early in our weeklong stay definitely soured me a bit on this hotel. Physically it's a nice property though and should be very nice once all the renos are completed. There are still a few finishing touches to be added - the stopper in the sink in one of our rooms didn't work, a bathroom door was pretty sticky, there was a full length mirror in one of the rooms and not the other, no mini fridges yet, etc - and they do continue to do quite a bit of rather noisy work during the day (and apparently they're behind schedule). We found most of the other staff - particularly the bellmen, valets, and cleaning staff - friendly and accommodating. A colleague of my husband's arrived later in the week and was treated very well by other front desk staff. He was even upgraded to a good-sized suite with a view of Fisherman's Wharf. But overall I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again, unless they were offering a good rate. There are many great hotels in the area!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: northwoodsdba
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at this hotel because I needed a room for a week at short notice - one of those sight-unseen bookings. The hotel itself was very nice. There was construction going on - but it was never intrusive, never a problem. I found the staff to be 50/50 between nice and helpful - and snotty and superior. The lady bartender should be avoided whenever possible. I had a room on the 27th floor with an excellent view towards Coit Tower. The room was large, well appointed, and bed was wonderful. The shower was very nice - and the shower head was high enough for me (I'm 6'4"). The housekeeping crew kept the room immaculate, and they just seemed to pop in at the proper time to straighten things up. The only negative would be juggling the temperature to keep it constant. The hotel was very convenient - Walking distance to the Moscone Center, two blocks to Chinatown, quite a bit of reasonable dining within easy walking distance. If I ever need to stay in that area again - I'd certainly go back to Hotel 480.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my Stay at Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: dprah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 480 during the 2008 Oracle Open World conference. The check in desk personnel were very welcoming, and my room was great! The hotel is undergoing a major renovation. I think I may have been the first one to stay in my room after it was renovated. In fact they were still working on some rooms on the floor. The room is very large and bright. The windows filled most of one wall. The furnishings were very nice, great colors! The bathroom was well lit and spacious enough. The bed and pillows - were so comfortable. Only odd thing was the lack of a full length mirror. And, $10/day for internet service was a bit steep. Walgreen 's was across the street, and I made several trips for water, diet coke and forgotten items. I would definitely recommend the hotel, and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A rip-off, though I do heart the comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: ncbabyblue717
Reviews.Content: After several nights of inns and motels on my road trip, I was so ready to sleep on a nice fluffy bed with equally fluffy pillows and duvet. Hotel 480 did not disappoint. Check-in was a breeze, and the staff was extremely courteous. The location made it easy to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go, which was great, because who wants to drive in SF? I have no complaints about my experience here; in fact, I would whole-heartedly recommend it to anyone...that is, anyone with deep pockets. Internet access was $10 per day, and parking was approximately $50 a day after taxes. Now, I'm from LA so I'm used to paying premium prices for parking and mandatory valet, but $50 was a sticker shock, even for me. In the end, everything added up to almost $300 a night for a room in a three-star hotel. We had a good experience here, but not THAT good.

Reviews.Title: “great value in s.f.”
Reviews.Author: danc219
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Because of the ongoing construction, (scaffolds on ouside of building),a bargain rate for this area. ($89) Many hotels in area are $200+.This is right on the cable car route.Just a few blocks down is the Grant street entrance to chinatown. Stayed on 10th floor.The room was newly remodeled and nice. It did not have fridge or microwave. Can buy the muni pass across street at walgreens which allows for unlimited bus and cable car rides.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price!”
Reviews.Author: dsi999
Reviews.Content: Went to San Fran as a late summer family vacation, and had a great time! As others have stated, this hotel is about a 5 block walk up a very slight hill from the BART station. We stayed at Hotel 480 Sunday through Wednesday, and while downtown we did not have a car, the BART, MUNI and cable cars all provide great access to wherever you want to go. While the hotel was undergoing rennovation during our stay, the only time we noticed any noise was between 9 and 5, and only noticed it when we got off the elevators. We had rooms 2101 and 2102, which was great because we had a little "alcove" that shut our two rooms off from the main hallway. Very private. Walgreens across the street sells passes to cable cars, and you can purchase whatever you forgot to pack! We too ate at Sears, and just 1 block up steep Powell Street is Sontano's Grill, which had a great happy hour, and then Roxanne's Cafe for some great pasta. We never did eat at the hotel; however, when I was speaking to the concierge about some restaurant choices in Napa, the chef did help give his recommendations for downtown SanFran and Napa area. Thursday and Friday we rented a car and drove to the Napa area (stayed in American Canyon) and that was also nice to get out of the city. Muir Woods seemed to "cleanse" us from the noice, hustle and bustle of the city. If you get a chance, go to Hurley's restaurant in Yountville, a family-owned restaurant that has a great heated outdoor patio, good food and great ambiance. Also ate at Cole's Chop House in Napa, good food as well but all ala carte and a bit pricey. Two 50 yr olds and two 21 year olds, and we all had a "favorite day" --Alcatraz, Bike the Bridge (you've got to do this, and have a great lunch in picturesque Sauscilito!), Muir Woods. Definitely worth a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in a 28th Floor Corner Jr Suite.Large windows overlooking the city and the bay.Room was clean and comfortable when we arrived and was quiet being 2 stories from the top.Hotel is going thru transitional period converting to a Marriott and the on site construction was not a issue for us at all. Booked the room thru Priceline and saved hundreds from hotel site.Hotel 480 is close to BART and right on Powell Cable car line. Check out Piraat Pizzeria down Sutter 600 block for amazing pizza,and Sears, 1/2 block down Powell has great food you can't go wrong.The best breakfast in San Fran ( They have many accolades) is at Mamas on Filbert 600 block on Washington Square..Get there early huge lines can develop for this one.We walked from Hotel 480 a couple of times to Mamas and built up a good morning appetite!! Try the walk to AT&T Park.. go up 3rd St to the Ballpark from Market, and then all the way back to Pier 39, down the Embarcadreo, it is splendid walking. Definitely would go back to Hotel 480 to enjoy another San Fran holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very good location bt rude staff”
Reviews.Author: gnikcin
Reviews.Content: reasonably priced, nice hotel, very good location. rude staff. i wud stay there again. cleaners took my sleeping bag by mistake and couldnt return it. very clean hotel, gym wasnt working and from the sounds of it, i wonder if it ever will open.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Csakzsu
Reviews.Content: The check-in went perfect even if we arrived very late. The rooms were clean, and big. The staff at the checkóin desk were helpful. The location of the hotel for a city trip is perfect, the Union square is 2 minutes away. Around the hotel there are several Strabucks caffees and diners. We felt very safe as the area is very busy but inside the hotel you did not hear the noise anymore. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “We've got much more than we've payed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolstapenhorst
Reviews.Content: My husband did the reservation 1 month in advance and we stayed 4 nigths for $99/rate. The room was adequate size, clean, good bathroom with an amazing tube, wonderfull king bed. High floor with a wiew. Starbucks just in fron of. Cablecar on the corner. The best location for a tourist: walking distance to stores and restaurants even in the night (we felt secure). Easy access to MUNI. The only problem: they make you phone call their providor (and wait a long time on the line) and pay $10/d to have internet and there staff are rude . A tip for first travelers to SF: Union Square is the best place to stay. Just: DON'T DARE HAVE A CAR THERE ($46/night).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: ellives
Reviews.Content: Got a huge room on the 29th floor. Two big beds plus a settee. Plenty of space and a great location. Five minutes to downtown, 2 minutes to union square. Starbucks outside the entrance plus a range of restaurants very closeby. did the tourist thing and had breakfast at Sears 1 minute away. Got there at 8am on Sunday morning,no queues. Truly a lovely breakfast. In all, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MissyWAlbuquerque_NM
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. Very good rate. Easy walk from Bart and 1 block from Union Square. Staff helpful, room clean, nice comfortable bed. Everything you might need (Walgreens), dining, close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel right in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: warwick290
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from Expedia just a couple of weeks before we arrived in San Francisco and were starting to panic that everything would be sold out. Hotel rates were also very high, but we found this one for $120 a night so took a chance. It's one block from Union Square and about 3 from Chinatown so the location is ideal. Our room was very spacious and comfortable, in fact we were delighted when we saw the room. We really think we got a bargain. The staff were friendly and helpful and everything about the hotel was clean and smart-looking. The only bad thing: we were charged an extortionate rate for wireless internet connection, and we stayed at much seedier, cheaper motels and hostels where internet was free!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: joenaustex
Reviews.Content: I get to San Fran every other month and this hotel ends up to be a great deal time after time. You can usually find a great deal on travelocity or orbitz. If you can, ask for a corner room. They are with two sides full of windows, huge king bed, two sitting areas, they also have a fridge. The hotel is in the heart of union square and has eating places across the street along with a walgreens.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: FLJulie
Reviews.Content: With so many hotels to choose from in San Francisco, I was hoping I had selected one that I could call Excellent and Hotel 480 fit the bill! The hotel and room exceeded my expectation and the location is perfect! Following check-in by a very helpful staff, we walked across the street from the hotel and hopped on a cable car - even my 15 year-old daughter thought that was pretty cool! Our room was large and very comfortable for the three of us (2 adults, 1 teenager). And after my husband dragged us around the city until 11:00pm we were happy that there was a Starbucks on an opposite corner! Would definitely recommed this hotel and it will be my first choice when we visit San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: pegster110
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel 480 and have no compaints whatsoever. Its a very decent hotel in a great location. Its close to great shopping and the Bart as well as being convenient for most of the major tourist options. All in all a solid hotel!

Reviews.Title: “West Coast's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: TCBeach
Reviews.Content: What a marvelous experience. I traveled to San Francisco with my 83 year old mother in May 08. The city is perfect for any age visitor. Beleive it or not the weather was fantastic! We happened to be there at the time of a heat wave 85 - 90 degrees everyday for five consecutive days. Stayed at the Hotel 480 near Union Square. I never thought a four day stay in a hotel room could be as enjoyable as this. We booked a junior suite - for the extra space. The room more than met our expectations. It was spacious with a beautiful view of the city. But to the city -charming, classy, eclectic, romantic, and definitely easy to navigate. Many modes of public transportation from the cable cars to trolleys to buses. Of course cabs are available but public transportation offers a real taste of the city. Be sure to visit the Ferry building (offers service to Sausalito - the beauty of Sausalito will blow your mind) and a farmers market on weekends, the Presidio, Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39 to see the seals bask in the sun, Haight Ashbury (a real kick). If time permits spend a day in Napa Valley - Sterling Vinyards offers a tram ride and wine tasting for $20 - good deal. "Stinking Rose" is a great restaurant in North Beach section of SF. Great Italian food. This was well worth the cross-country flight as we are east coast residents. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Stay Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 480 June 21-23. We arrived early so they held our bags till we could check in later in the day. The bellman and the front desk clerk were very friendly. They both offered great advice about how to get tickets for the transporation in the city. The bellman drew a map and wrote down the Hotel phone # in case we got lost. The hotel location is fantastic. One block from the square. Starbucks, and Walgreens across the street.Our room was large with two double beds, large picture window overlooking the city. Nice fluffy towels with Bath & body works samples. Our beds were comfortable.The hotel needs to upgrade the pillows to feather pillows not foam. A mini fridge would be nice too.My girls enjoyed playing the cd player in the room. Nice size tv with remote. We would definitly stay at Hotel 480 in the future.Valet parking is quite expensive. That's the city. I did find one block over the Sutter/Stockton Parking lot for 33.50 a day.Still high but more reasonable then the hotel and most of the lots in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 480”
Reviews.Author: cookinma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a terrific location near Union Square with restaurants and trolley line. Very clean, with a huge corner room. Nice staff, very helpful concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and service - a bit noisy though”
Reviews.Author: IanDuncan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 18th floor of this hotel for seven nights. (Me, my wife and three kids aged 7, 9 and 9 yrs) The rooms were clean, and the service we received was as expected from a four star hotel... Toiletries and towels replaced every day, room immaculate on our return, etc. (One or two days the room was only serviced after lunch, inconveniencing us a little. However, a call to housekeeping corrected that for the balance of our stay.) Staying in the middle of a big city, noise is expected. We were surprised however at the city policy to collect refuse between 1am and 5am. Closed windows helped somewhat, but if you are not used to this it can be disturbing. The hotel is extremely well situated in the city. It it literally two blocks from the gates to Chinatown, and three blocks from the main city block. We did not need a car at all for the time we stayed there. (We had, however, just complete a two week stint in Orlando seeing the parks, so my family were walking fit ). We had a wonderful walk from the hotel to Pier 39, and returned along one of the tram lines. The hotel was also quite accommodating to provide additional blankets, and a very early checkout. A further value of the hotel is that it is situated across the road from a Walgreens where we bought milk and cereal to save on breakfast costs. On the opposite corner is Starbucks who made a reasonable Venti Cuppucino ! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: snickm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February on our first visit to San Francisco - and we were extremely pleased with the location and value. It's located one block from Union Square, and there is a trolley stop just outside the hotel. There's also quite a few restaurants nearby, not to mention the one that's in the lobby. There is also a little deli that has a variety of breakfast foods to choose from. I wasn't particulary impressed with the quality, but it was handy. I would recommend, however, recommend eating breakfast at Sears Fine Foods (about 1/2 a block from the hotel). Two other things I liked about this hotel: 1) our room had a nice view of the bay and Coit Tower. I don't normally get up early enough to watch the sun rise, but I couldn't help it with that view. 2) The staff was incredibly friendly to us. This is a fine hotel that's reasonably priced, has great service and a terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: neonp
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property in 1995 when it was a Holiday Inn, and loved the fact that it was right on the cable car line. During our most recent trip, we wanted to spend the night in San Francisco, and I was able to contact the hotel directly during our drive to book a room. While I had requested a King room with a rollaway for the three of us, upon arrival the desk clerk suggested that the room would be crowded that way, and suggested a room with two doubles--this was fine, except that I am married to a big guy and am used to a queen bed. Nonetheless,, the room was very comfortable, and quiet. The decor was quite nice as well, and the room was very clean. I did know that I would need to have the car valet parked, but when we arrived, because of the luggage carrier on the roof, they informed me that they would have to charge me the oversize vehicle parking fee! Also, one of the front desk clerks (not the one who checked us in), insisted that the bellman take our bags to the room, making me feel obligated to tip him. It must have been a hotel image thing, because I did not necessarily need or want a bellman's assistance! Also, expect to pay to use anykind of computer/internet service! I think $25 a day is a bit absurd, let alone the 2.99 an hour if using at the business center. While the room charge was VERY reasonable for San Francisco, beware of the "extras" that will get tacked on to the bill! Otherwise, it is a fantastic place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: 99TravelBug99
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Hotel 480 over Memorial Day Weekend. The hotel was in a great location, right near Union Square and all the shopping and about 3-4 blocks from China Town. Got a great deal for $119/night which I thought was good for a holiday weekend in San Fran. Staff was friendly, bartender recommended some restaurants and a fun piano bar a few blocks down. Rooms were cleaned promtply every day. Shower was good. My complaints are that the bed was pretty hard. Not terrible but enough to feel it in your back when you woke up. Also, the walls are very thin, we could hear our neighbors. But aside from that, the location and price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rioss
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel 480 for 6 nights for a holiday. For the price paid (approx USD90), it was a great deal. The hotel is located just 2 blocks from Union Square where all the shopping and food are, just opposite a pharmacy / convenience store, borders bookstore, and right outside the cable car tram stop! Major bus lines, tram lines, BART station are just short walks away. Safe enough for a single traveller, as the roads are always crowded with people. The room decor is very old-fashioned, but it comes with everything you need (except a minibar), and is very clean and comfortable. The room, bed, bathroom is nice and big. Despite the age of the furnishings, it didnt smell too dated! Frontdesk , bell, housekeeping staff are fast, helpful and knowledgable. No wireless internet in the room, but wired internet available for USD10 for 24 hrs. Had a lot of problems getting connected, but the internet company had a good toll-free helpline. For this price, i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, maybe worth it after rennovations done”
Reviews.Author: jkimes
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for me based on location and price. Yes, the location is great, especially since I'm a Bay Area native, now living in Central Texas and was looking forward to a city "fix". The room was a decent size (especially compared to European standards) and clean. The bed was very comfortable, and housekeeping kept the room very clean. The main problem was that I only stayed 5 nights, and 3 times the heat was off. The first time, a worker came and told me they had just turned the heat back on and he wanted to make sure it was working--turned off for renovations in another part of hotel. Another time, I came back to my room and the thermostat had been turned off. The last morning, the thermostat was not working at all. I also came back one evening to no lights in my entry way or bath. They fixed the problem while I was out for dinner, but in my opinion I had one too many issues during my short stay. I might consider staying here again when they have completed the update and (hopefully) stop playing with the heating system...

Reviews.Title: “Great value - get it while it lasts”
Reviews.Author: dentarthurdent
Reviews.Content: 3 nights in downtown SF (one block from Union Sq) for only $99 per night. At these prices, who cares about tired decor? Rumour has it (overheard in the lift) that this former Crowne Plaza is only on gardening leave before becoming a Marriott - prices will surely rise. At the moment, you get a large, clean room in a great location - which is all we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: firecopcouple
Reviews.Content: When checking in, the staff was friendly but I couldn't seem to "encourage" any upgrades or niceties. It was mentioned we were pre-paid through Expedia as an excuse to just check us in without fanfare. Everything was good but a little stoic, when we disturbed the maid still cleaning the assigned room. A call to the front desk immediately got us an upgraded room (family suite) with plenty of apologies. I suspect my first desk clerk was just a little tired or distracted and wasn't in the mood for my cajoling. No regrets, the room was wonderfully large enough to accommodate my teenage daughter’s explosion of clothes and travel supplies. The hotel is on the cable line with a stop on the corner. Rides to Market Street were almost unnecessary because five blocks downhill was nothing. Coming home or going to the piers was easy with the cable line. My only regret is my room looked directly at The Cheesecake Factory two blocks away on top of Macys. I think I resisted one night out of four, going to sleep without a slice of "sin" ruining my diet. For those needing a workout facility, the hotel's is being remodeled. They give you a "comp" card for 24 hr fitness five blocks away. It wasn't offered at first but seemed to be no problem once I asked. Do eat at "Sears fine foods" across the street and down the block (visible from the front door). Their mini Swedish pancakes are fantastic. French toast was pretty good as well. Overall, I think I enjoyed the best medium budget version of a downtown hotel. You can spend less and get a lot less. I not sure you can get much more without really turning out your wallet. For trips three days and over, buy the Muni pass. Cable cars are $5 a ride no matter how short and the Muni subway and busses are easy to figure out. You can see every sight without a car. This is truly a mass transit city, so take advantage

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: GandT-n-WV
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just a few blocks from the Mall and lots of nice places to eat there, street car just 60 feet from front entrance. The view, we were on the 28th floor and had a wonderful view. I Would like to stay there again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeforeSunrise
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Crown Plaza and it still feels like one. Everything has been refreshed/updated, but very basic. Nothing is particularly wrong, but nothing wows you either. The location is great and the front desk service is exceptionally friendly and helpful. However, for this price, I felt like I wanted something more special.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Jmbradle
Reviews.Content: We got a great cheap price -- $160/nite. Excellent for the location in the shopping district of Union Square. The room was clean and partially updated with white linens and duvet. Walls seem thin, but no trouble with loud noise. Good workout room. Very helpful bellman, Perry, who got me bag back when I left it in the airport shuttle bus! Great value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - RUDE RUDE RUDE desk staff”
Reviews.Author: weeangel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in December 07 (single female travelling alone from the UK) and chose this hotel 1. to get Priority Club points 2. for the location. The location is superb - absolutely excellent, really can't fault it for being so central to the main shopping - I even went back a couple of times on my non-work day to drop off bags. No problems at all re safety, going out to eat in the evenings on my own etc etc. However - the front desk staff are appalling. When I went to empty my safety deposit box prior to check out (10 mins to go) I waited in line until it was my turn, went to the desk to be told, very rudely, that I had to wait while a bunch of airline staff were checked out. No apologies - no 'would you mind if we dealt with these people first' just literally 'WAIT'!! So rude!!!! I stated that I had a plane to catch as well to be told that didn't matter! Regardless of the great location you couldn't pay me to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel 480! Highly Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Steri-Clean
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in San Francisco (Union Square). I can't say enough about it. Other reviews before ours complained about renovations, but they must be completed now because we saw no signs of this. The rooms were clean and the staff always went out of there way to make us feel as if we were their only guests. The view from our room overlooking Union Square and the entire City was unbelievable. We sat at the bar late one night and received excellent service from Thomas a long time bartender there. The hotel is on the cable car line which gives you easy access to anywhere you want to go outside of Union Square. Everything else from restaraunts, night clubs, and all the shops are within easy walking distance. The conciere was so helpful with everything from trip planning to printing out our boarding passes for our return trip home. If you are looking for a room in the Union Square area, I highly recommend Hotel 480....soon to become a Marriot though.

Reviews.Title: “A City of Two Halves”
Reviews.Author: Toddy04
Reviews.Content: We spent a month traveling through Austria, Germany, Italy and the Czech Republic and decided on a three day stopover in San Francisco on our way back to New Zealand to help get over our jet lag. We booked this hotel through our travel agent (our agent never contacted us to say it had changed names since we booked and paid) together with our flights. It was expensive but we thought with the Crowne Plaza name and having read other Trip Advisor reviews we would be happy. I had booked our nine hotels in Europe directly through their websites after reading Trip Advisor reviews. All of them were wonderful so we were looking forward to our three nights of luxury in San Francisco to finish an incredible month long trip. We arrived after two flights from Europe, 16 hours in total and checked in with no problems. We were taken to our room on the 10th floor and were told how lucky it was that we had such a huge one. We thought it was very dated and we were not very happy with two double beds instead of a queen or king as advertised, but it was tolerably clean. It was a disabled room with all the equipment left in the bathroom. The room was also very cold. While my husband tried to warm up the air conditioning I decided a shower would help the jet lag and the disappointment with the room. However there was no hot water!! We rang reception and they said the hotel was undergoing renovations and that they would send a plumber. The longer we waited the more upset we became so we went to reception to complain about the above. The receptionist said as there was a conference on she could do little. We explained that we had paid over $400 a night and were ready to leave. She said that she would make an exception and reorganize things and upgrade us to a much higher floor with a room with a King size bed. We were very tired and grateful that we could finally have a shower and freshen up. The room was okay, very dated but clean and we had our hot shower. The hotel is undergoing refurbishment and there were people working outside our window. There were ropes and men dangling just outside. The worst was to come though. When we finally got to bed that night we realized that our bed backed on to the lifts and they are in use continually until about 5am. We felt like we were still on the aeroplane. Earplugs didn't lessen the noise much because you could also feel the movement of the lifts. As it was our first time in San Francisco we made the most of the bad situation and got as tired as possible seeing all the sights. The weather was wonderful and it was great to walk everywhere and also take the lovely Cablecar. We had the most amazing breakfast at Mama's Cafe (worth the half hour wait outside) and also nice dinners at North Beach. I will never book hotel accommodation again through a travel agent as I think this may have assisted the problem.I will also never go back to this hotel in spite of its good location. I feel Reception were probably laughing that they had got one over us with the lift problem in spite of pretending they were doing us a favor

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTB
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel, especially for the price (about $90 per night via priceline on Valentine's/ President Day weekend). The location is GREAT - right in the heart of the union square area. The staff was very kind & attentive, they upgraded us to a jr. suite upon arrival, since they were sold out of regular rooms with king sized beds. The room was large, comfortable & very clean (the carpeting was a bit old, but I believe they are renovating). I would stay there again & for me (a very picky hotel guest, who won't step foot into a hotel unless it's rated at bare minimum 3 stars) that's saying a lot. It's not a 4 or 5 star luxury hotel by any means, but I would recommend it for a nice weekend getaway when you want to be right in the heart of things - especially if you get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 480 is still a great place”
Reviews.Author: APAlSoCal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel 480 for at least 4 nights each of the past 7 years. It was the Crowne Plaza for the first 6 and recently became the Hotel 480 before my most recent stay. The service remains top notch and the rooms are comfortable. Not much has changed since the name switch. The only difference I noted was the absence of the Crowne Plaza "sleep kit", which isn't that much of a loss. The mattresses and bedding are pleasant and there is plenty of work space if you are on business. If you are travelling with family, I suggest you request one of their "Family Rooms". These rooms are at the end of each floor. I've stayed on both ends-if you like the sound of cable cars, the rooms located on the Powell and Sutter corner will do just fine. If you want more quiet, try to get the opposite end of the hall. The location is fantastic with many shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. As noted earlier, two cable car routes run right past the hotel and their are numerous taxis on the street. The BART station is down Powell Street, about a easy 10 minute walk. The hotel is going to go through a year-long remodeling project. Five floors at a time will be refurbished, so be sure to ask about the work in progress before you book. I spend quite a few nights of the year in hotels on business and I always enjoy my stay at this property. One addition I hope they do make is to put a spark in their on site bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large rooms, good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fluffychuffy
Reviews.Content: The locaiton of this hotel is great - right near all the shopping and minutes from China Town and other restaurants. Really enjoyed my stay here - very nice big room, perfectly clean and spacious. This is not a luxury hotel but is certainly good quality and has everything you need. Is being turned in to a Marriott I think so will be up to that standard soon I imagine. I have no complaints - price was good, hotel in exellent location, nice and clean, friendly people, great big room, lots of channels on the TV - what more could you want? There is a good restaurant called the Daily Grill which serves nice brekkies, lunch and dinner - it is like an upmarket diner - as you come out of the hotel, walk straight down the hill towards Union Square - keep walking and you will pass Union Square on the left hand side and Victoria's secret on the right then take the next right and you will see the restaurant on the left hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 480 - Great Union Square Location”
Reviews.Author: CSquaredC2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 480 late in December after booking an overnight stay using Priceline. I think it used to be the Crowne Plaza and now has a banner over it saying Hotel 480. I get the impression it's still undergoing a remodel, but not sure. First off, the location is great. Right across from Sir Francis Drake, the Disney Store and Borders. The lobby was nice and clean and looked like it's gone through a recent transformation. Once you step off the elevator and onto your floor, you can tell the upper floors have not been remodeled. The decor in the halls and rooms were not what you expected from the lobby. I assume they are still renovating. It was mostly clean and comfortable and appropriate if all you need is a place to sleep. The staff was nice and the one big drawback was the parking. I valet'd and when I checked out Sunday I had to wait 45 minutes to get the car. I tried calling the valet desk in advance but couldn't get through, so just went down. It was obvious they were short staffed, kind of disorganized and aplogetic. It was somewhat frustrating as it appeared people who turned in their tickets after me got their cars before mine. One gentleman before me had been waiting much longer than me though. This could be because I went on a holiday weekend though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: bright2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline. I was a little wary at first since I could not find reviews for this hotel, but I later realized that what they now call Hotel 480 was actually the former Crowne Plaza Union Square. First off, the hotel is very clean and the staff are very pleasant. Even when I called beforehand to confirm my reservation, the front desk was very helpful and very willing to note my room preferences. Usually, when I book with other hotels using Priceline, I get a lot of "what we have left is what you get" type of responses, but not this hotel. Their pleasant, efficient service continued when I checked in in person. I had a guest with me and they even automatically asked her what her name was, just in case we lost keys and she needed to get in. Room - they honored our request and put us on the 20th floor with a nice view. The windows span the wall and give you a very expansive, airy feel. The room is cozy, but very clean and tastefully decorated. We got a king bed that was rather comfortable - wasn't the best of the beds I've slept in, but not bad. There were a couple of annoyances, however. First, valet parking at $43 + 14% tax (almost 50!) is just absurd. The second night, I found local garage parking for about $26 overnight. Secondly, internet service in the room is restricted to wired only. Normally that would be fine, but my gf and I both had to do work and were using separate computers. Without wireless, we couldn't do that at the same time. All in all, this hotel is great, beats many 4 stars that I've stayed in before, and is well worth it (especially given the low fare we found using priceline). I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMike
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza, Union Square, San Francisco. We were extremely pleased with our recent two night stay. Room was nicely appointed, well maintained, and clean. Directly on the Powell Street Cable Car line - and a rather steep two block walk to the California Street Cable line. Walk to everything in Union Square- as well as to the Moscone. You're just blocks fron the Chinatown Gate on Grant St. Pricey breakfast buffet was well worth the expense- it was over the top and the best of everything: fruit, pastries, yogurt, artisan cheeses, cakes, breads- not to mention the cooked to order items. Service is nothing short of exceptional. Each evening we walked to the nearby pubs and enjoyed a drink or two. You will still need to be mindful of the "street people" in this neighborhood, especially at night, but overall- you won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidAndPed
Reviews.Content: Really happy with our stay, wanted to stay another night! What a great location, step out of the hotel an a block away you are at union square. Will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jcolesw2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights during a trip to USA. Can only reiterate others' comments. Great location next to Union Square and a great place to be based for a trip in San Fran. Good rates for a room on the exec floor with breakfast. Huge rooms with extremely comfortable beds. Very very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “SO private yet a stones throw from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, but the rooms were great and seo close to Union Square! We had a ball and had 2 rooms from Hotwire for only $55 a night all taxes. I would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: smiffy79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights in September as part of our 2 week holiday in America. The hotel was in a great location near Union Square and we were able to walk to most places which we really enjoyed. We got the BART from the airport to the hotel – it was shortish walk from the station but we found the hotel very easily. We had booked the hotel through priority points and I think may have got an upgrade because of this. Our room was very large and had a beautiful view over Nob hill with the cable cars running up and down. The bed was huge and very comfortable. There was some noise at night and you could hear the cable cars going up and down sometimes but I think that is what you expect in a big city! We had a wonderful time in San Francisco – we ended up walking nearly everywhere as the queues for the cable cars were ridiculous. There are so many nice restaurants to choose from, you are spoilt for choice. We ate at Lori’s diner on our first night which is just next to the hotel and is great for burgers and shakes! We had breakfast at Sears fine foods one morning when we were up early and it was really good, thankfully there was no queue as there was one every other morning. Other than that we ventured further out to Chinatown, North Beach etc and found some great places. I would definitely recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone, it is in a great location in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: yvieinca
Reviews.Content: The Crowne was booked for us by my husbands work. It was one of the few hotels still available for the VMWorld conference, so we took it at a rate of $210 a night. When we arrived, we found the parking garage and pulled in. We were quickly told that we couldn’t get any help with our bags if we stayed in the parking garage, but the nice man there offered to bring the car around front for us so that we could go check in then get our bags. This was greatly appreciated after our nerve wracking trip from the South Bay to the city. (We stayed the previous two nights in the south bay to visit some friends). My husband and I gathered up our few items we wanted to keep with us at all times, and walked down the very steep (and slippery, BE CAREFUL!) garage area to the stairs outside to enter the hotel. When we arrived inside the lobby we saw the lobby packed with airline employees waiting to check out. There were probably 50-75 people ahead of us in line. My husband sat down on a bench with our items and I waited outside for our car. Our car arrived about 15 minutes later just as all the airline employees were boarding a bus to apparently go to work. As I helped the bellman unload the car, my husband called to let me know we were checked in and ready to go. The Crowne had upgraded us to a junior suite on the 23rd floor. The view from the room was absolutely spectacular, we slept with the curtains open every night so we could see the beautiful city lights. The room was quite nice and spacious. The bathroom was against the back wall, next to that was a small table and chairs for eating or playing cards. There was a rather large living room area with a sofa, coffee table, a chair and a television in a cabinet with some drawers and a refrigerator. Beyond that was a half wall separating the living area from the sleeping area. Directly in front of the bed was a desk with a light and outlets ready for your laptop. The room was very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable with plenty of blankets and pillows. Internet was not included in the price of the room. It was $10 a day for internet access, or $35 for the week. I understand that this is typical in upscale hotels, even though it frustrates me. That being said, when I pay for internet access in a hotel, I expect enough bandwidth to be able to conduct business (VPN access). The download speeds were frequently less than 200kbps, which is totally unacceptable. This was one of the recommended hotels for the VMWorld conference, which is a computer-related convention. A hotel should expect high internet usage when they are a participant hotel for a high-tech conference, and be prepared to handle it. Even on Thursday night, when most of the conference participants had left, the bandwidth still didn’t exceed 310kbps. My expectations for $10/day internet access are much higher than free WiFi in non-premium hotels, and unfortunately the Crowne Plaza didn’t come close to meeting those expectations. We opted not to use the room service available, since the cheapest thing on the menu was a $22 hamburger that didn’t seem all that special from the description on the menu. A morning pot of coffee was $7, and a basic breakfast was over $15. Instead we went to the grocery store and bought a few staple items and frequented restaurants in the area. Most of the staff members we ran in to were very polite and friendly, especially the housekeeping staff. Parking was somewhat of a fiasco. It took a minimum of 15 minutes every time we needed our car, sometimes closer to a half an hour. At one point one of the door men got rather testy with me and told me I should call for the car before going downstairs, otherwise we should just go to the garage ourselves to get the car.
