(Which was fine with me, less tipping!) Not only did they expect a tip every time we got in or out of the car, the parking was $60 a day. (Yes, I said $60 A DAY). I understand real estate is at a premium in SF, but $60 a day?!?!? Again, no choice we had to pay it. When we went to check out my husband mentioned the problems with the internet, and how important it was for him to have internet access, he was met with a snide “Sorry”, and handed a receipt. Overall the room was lovely and most of the staff were polite and helpful. Would I stay here again? Maybe. It surely wouldn’t be my first choice by any stretch. It’s very important for computer people to have reliable internet access. If it were free, we wouldn’t complain, but considering less expensive hotels have better internet access this was a big disappointment. The room service menu being SO highly priced also put us off a little. The parking, well honestly it was kind of disastrous for us. So only in a pinch would we stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Would recommend and stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: designjb
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Located just a block or so north of Union Square. It's an easy walk to Chinatown, the subway and all of the dining and shopping in the area. I bid for the hotel on Priceline and got it for $77 (pre tax) for Labor Day weekend (Sept 1-3, 2007) so not a bad deal at all. We were in room 806, which was a corner room. It was larger than the other hotel rooms, though it had 2 queen beds, not a king. There was a welcoming packet on the bed with linen spray, eye patches and ear plugs for a good night's rest. Staff seemed very friendly, though we did not deal with them much. Hotel has the usual: soda machine, free ice machine, toiletries included shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, bar soap and shower cap. Small coffee maker in the room. Nice little cafe right across the street for a coffee, pasty or quick glass of wine. There's a Walgreens pharmacy kitty-corner to the hotel if you need to stock up on supplies. Dotties (522 Jones) is on of the best brekfast joints EVER! Be Prepared to wait in line for an hour, but it's almost worth it. The place it tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Yarnold
Reviews.Content: 3 of us shared a quad room for 5 nights whilst sightseeing. After arriving gone midnight and missing our luggage due to flight delays, the only Porter on duty was able to run around and get us all the toiletries and Robes we needed to relieve the effects of travelling for 36 hours. Our room was very spacious over looking Sutter Street itself, I suspect it may have been a disabled room because of the wetroom and rails, instead of a bath. No issue with cleanliness and beds very comfy indeed. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NovAbroad
Reviews.Content: We booked a family holiday on the West Coast of US and stayed at Crowne Plaza Garden Grove, Caesars Las Vegas, Crowne Plaza Union Square San Francisco and Crowne Plaza Redondo Beach LA. I am a Priority Club member that is why my preference for Crowne Plaza. There were 7 of us in two rooms at each hotel. The Crowne Plaza Union Square is in a great location with the cable car stop just outside (Powell Street) and is close to great shops. The run to the bay isn't too bad. The hotel is a little old and could do with a refurb. We booked 4 months in advance and asked for adjoining rooms but ended up on seperate floors. OK but wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: Richk582
Reviews.Content: On a bussiness trip, stayed here one night. Really just not that impressed with this hotel. Close to the Cable Car line, but other than that, not really in the best of locations. Lobby was dark, not very colorful or welcoming. Staff was friendly but i was practically forced to use a bellhop for my one bag. I think i can find my own way to the room, thanks. Elevators were quick and always available, but needed to be updated. Many of the buttons wouldn’t light, or the floor numbers were not legible. Room was, again, ok but not great. Furnishings were old, dark, not updated. View wasn’t that great. Bathroom also needed an update as everything just seemed old. Bed was ok, not very comfy, alarm clock was some kind of crazy thing that played different nature sounds or chiming bells for an alarm. Really, i just need a simple to use alarm clock I'm not really a big fan of the Holiday-Inn owned properties, and for the price of this hotel would rather stay at a Hyatt, or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: aimblkjak21
Reviews.Content: We stayed that the Crowne Plaza for three nights. Upon check in our room was not ready but they offered us a $40 a night upgrade to an executive level room. It was well worth it since it includes breakfast each morning, free internet access in the room and drink coupons. The room was very clean and best of all it was quiet. Very quiet! Bathroom was a little on the small side but I could deal with it. Espically since I was very, very clean. I love when hotels actually clean the grout in the shower! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even the bellhops were willing to give directions and pointers on good places to eat or visit. Location is great as you are right outside of a cable car stop and about a 5 minute walk to Union Square. Sear's Fine Food and Lori's diner are right accross the street and are wonderful for a quick lunch. I would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely breakfest.....”
Reviews.Author: kuiken
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple nights in the Crown Plaza, and it was a pleasant stay. The staff behind reception, most important people when your arrive, first impression, were helpfull. Information is good, and welwilling. The staff offered the 11% discount card for the Macy's store themselves, I did not had to ask for it. And when I forgot my keycard, no problem a new one was made without any questions. Compliment. The room was good. 17th floor. Specially the dream-and sleep comfortbag. They know that people from Europe have there jet-lag problems.There is a CD-player in the room, with excersises to relax with nice music. An eyecover, a pillow-perfume and so on. that's what people call: custumor service. The breakfest: Nice and charming atmosphere. Plenty of choices from the buffet and the menu. Helpfull staff, and for most of all very friendly. That's something people want and need in the morning after a 11 hour flight. Location is als great, nearby the Union Square with al the shops and the cablecar in the front. My stay: just short, was a pleasant stay in San Francisco. The Crown Plaze took care of it. And myself of course. Yes: a hotel to recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hbyerly
Reviews.Content: Good-sized room w new bedding (7 layers of comfort). Clean, well-appointed bathroom, but quite small. Amenity kit with linen spray in room. Great downtown location, $9 cab ride to Pier 39. Restaurant is v expensive - $22 for eggs and bacon. Front desk is outstanding, concierge very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Crowne Plaza Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sullymom
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this Crowne Plaza. The staff is to great, they cannot do enough to make your trip great! From the Concierge to housekeeping and everyone in between they were great. Our room was CLEANED every day, and I mean clean! We were upgraded to a "family room" which was 2 doubles and a queen sleeper for just a few dollars more well worth it!! The location is the best. You are a half a block from Union Sq. and a few feet from the cable car stop. No need for a car in the city! I would stay here again if I'm every able to get to the oppostie coast again:)

Reviews.Title: “This was one of my best stays in San Francisco! Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha808
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and knew this hotel was convenient, but I had no idea how exceptionally close this hotel was to shopping, dining, transportation, everything, until I got there. It was an easy walk to whatever I wanted: for example, one night I peeked in at Farallon, decided I wouldn't fit in; strolled over to Kuleto's, too packed; came back to Scala's Bistro. All within minutes. I'm still amazed at how close I was to everything. The service was excellent. The front desk was always courteous and thorough. The bellmen were beyond-the-call helpful. I don't know about other posters, but I found my bed to be very comfortable. It's not the Westin's "Heavenly Bed," but every night when my head hit all four pillows, I'd be out like a light....and getting up was truly a chore. I used their aromatherapy spray and relaxation CD, too. The shower massage has six settings, which I found novel. The handicap bar in the shower seemed to be in an awkward place and I bumped it constantly. I liked that the housekeeper replenished the toiletries every day. (Hey, you'd THINK that was basic in a 4*, but that hasn't always happened!) The workout room is a little cramped, but OK if just a few people are using it. When I finished on the treadmill, there were 3 other people in there and the guy on the elliptical machine had to stop pedaling so that I could squeeze past him! It's nice to have a workout room IN the hotel, though. The machines are newish and clean; they have a water dispenser; and there's a TV in there, which I hogged. I was a little bummed out that the internet service in the business area was so expensive, but fortunately I didn't have to use it much at all. Overall, it was a VERY enjoyable stay. Kudos to the staff, who were warm and welcoming. I hope I get to stay here again! I've told all my friends about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big room, simple amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Davidwithoutborders
Reviews.Content: Great location, just north of Union Square. The staff let us check-in early. Very big room, clean and great water pressure in bathroom. Drawbacks - basic amenities, and beds were not particularly comfy. Also, hotel beginning to show its age. Overall, though, very happy with stay and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “liked location”
Reviews.Author: Tixilix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 nights on our honeymoon. We paid for an executive room but got a suite which was very large and quiet. The decor was perhaps a little tired and the bath small. The Wi Fi is not free here which was an issue for us.Breakfast is not included but is not expensive, the public areas of the hotel could do with updating. Service was fine. The best thing about the hotel is the location by Union square handy for everywhere. We tried to get in the Mark Hopkins initially and went to the wonderful bar whilst in san francisco, The mark hopkins appeared to be of a higher standard but is up a very steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gasLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend there. Did not need a car, or anything else for a great time. Easy walk from the train station to the hotel. Right in the center of everything in Union Square and the theater district, all an easy walk. Trolly car stop right outside th door. Wallgreens type drug store across the street. Endless restaurants, shopping, theatres all around. Quick trolly ride down to Fisherman,s Warf. Bicycle ride over the Golden Gate Bridge. All without ever using a taxi or car. Hotel had very clean, spacious well appointed rooms in new looking condition. My room had a nice city and bay view. Reasonable rate. Very quick check in. Absolutely nothing to complain about on my trip or with this hotel. 2 blocks from Union Square park where I spent hours just sitting, sipping beer, reading and people watching in the center of an art exhibit. Great! 75 degree sunny weather helped alot. All I needed was a female companion to make it perfect. Lots of attractive people there. With more time I could have fallen in love. The photos below are from my bicycle trip around the bay. 8 miles biking with a ferry ride back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GiGiBe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious and up to date. Beds were comfortable, bathroom was nice and updated, and I liked the CD player/alarm clock on the nightstand. The hotel is in a great location at the corner of Sutter and Powell in walking distance of restaurants and stores. The cable car stop is right on the corner by hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge, Cathy, was very knowledgeable, helpful, and always happy to help. Downside -- no refrigerators in the rooms, and I had to pay $10 per day for Internet access. Also, no breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Location A+++, very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza Union Square for a conference for five days at the end of February, 2007. The hotel was predetermined, but I was still apprehensive after reading some of the reviews here. On arrival from the east coast on an early flight, I was greeted at the front desk by Jeff. He was pleasant and efficient, and had me on my way to my room in minutes. My room was on the 16th floor, and although I would have preferred higher, it was all that was available. On the floor, in addition to rooms along the main corridor, there were five or six alcoves, with additional rooms off of them. To get to my room, I had to take a right, right and another right off of the elevator. This layout really cut down on the corridor traffic noise, but the room backed up to the noisy elevator shaft. The room itself was a king room, small, and dominated by the bed. There was also a chair and ottoman, large bureau, desk, and closet. The bathroom was small but efficiently laid out>>but if my wife were with me, there would have been a turf war over the bathroom size. The large window looked out over Powell St, and had a side window that opened, letting in fresh air. Street noise was heard, even with the window closed, but not as intrusive as the always present elevator noise. The room itself was immaculate...under the bed, behind the endtable, everywhere. Possibly the cleanest hotel room I have ever been in. Back to the bathroom for a minute. Nice toiletries, plenty of clean, fluffy towels, and great water pressure. Tub/shower was very narrow, and water got all over the floor after each shower. Maybe the addition of a curved shower curtain rod would diminish the cramped feel. The beds are really trumpeted, both on the website and in ads around the hotel. While comfortable, I didn't find it warranted the bragging. The lobby was functional and clean, and several in our group used the concierge, finding her helpful. As far as location, it was convenient to everywhere. Union Square was one block awayand Fishermans Wharf/Pier 39, etc is just a ride away on the famous cablecars that go right by out front of the hotel. I did not use room service, or the restaurants at the hotel, but did note that the food provided by the hotel as part of the conference was very good. I decided to attack the debate about breakfast restaurants I read about in the SF forum. I went to Lori's Diner across the street on the first morning. The food was excellent, and plentiful, and the waitstaff was extremely friendly and helpful. As I walked around the area after breakfast, I noticed about 20-25 people standing on line in front of Sears Fine Foods one block away. The next two mornings, I went to Sears for breakfast, didn't have to wait, and the food and service were exceptional. Prices were comparable. My vote in the debate would be for Sears, but you can't go wrong with either. Bottom line, the hotel was everything it presented itself to be on the website and in hotel literature. I have no regrets staying there, and would stay here again if ever back in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zigy
Reviews.Content: First time we have been to San Francisco and found the whole week very enjoyable. This hotel is in a great location for both shopping and local transport. The hotel services we found were good with good rooms size and comfortable beds. We did not eat in the hotel as there are plenty of places out and about. We went to Sears across the road for breakfast most mornings (opposite the Francis Drake hotel,) exceptional breakfast and good value. We did the city tour and napa valley from the hotel. The concierge arranged it for us through Pacific Tours. The tour company use smaller 12 seater minibuses which is great for getting to know your fellow tourists, Geordie is a good guide and driver. We would definetely consider this hotel if we went back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaze is just a block off of Union Square, so the location is very central, but that's probably the best thing is has going for it. I stayed in a King room on an executive floor, but couldn't really tell you what was "executive" about it. The decor was very average and not what I would have expected for $250 a night. My rate included a continental breakfast, which was served in their cafe downstairs. The food was pretty uninspired, but there was a wide selection of options. Good for free - If I had to pay the $19 fee for this meal I would have been very disappointed. Interesting features worth noting: -there was no mini bar in the room, but there was a small fridge which was empty. If you're there for an extended stay and want to buy a few things for yourself instead of paying sky high rates for snacks and drinks, this could be helpful. -if you have a computer with you and need to print a document, they had a nice service I haven't seen before where you could upload a document to their website and then have it printed and delivered to your room or pick it up at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: MzMiata
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of our tour from Los Angeles to San Francisco, so we did not really have a choice as to where we were to stay. The room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The only downfall was that we got a smoking room, which was not very pleasant. This is not the fault of the hotel management as the room was allocated to us by the tour guide. I was able to use the free wireless internet from the lobby of the hotel. Other than that, we found the hotel to be pretty good...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Unpretentious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobSu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and the experience was delightful. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Our room was very spacious with great views down Powell and west to Ocean Beach. This was our 3rd stay in SF and this was without doubt the best hotel and not the most expensive we've stayed in. 1 block from Union square with the cable car going past the hotel, this is ideal for shopping and access to the excellent public transport system. We would recommend this hotel for business or vacation, it is unpretentious and the effort is therefore put into making the guests stay hassel free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling33
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel stay. I was in town for less than fun reasons (my father was having surgery) so having a nice retreat was wonderful. The room was large and very clean. The bed and bedding were cozy. Had dinner at the end of the day at the restaurant on site and had a delicious dinner. The location is good, close to Union Square and theaters. The staff was very nice. Free internet would be a welcomed improvement, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bhoffa24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from spending 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza. Good: Staff- The staff was one of the highlights of this hotel. Every employee said hello or asked how we were doing whether it was the doorman or one of the maids. Location- right where you want to be. one block away from Union Square, cable car stop across the street, and within walking distance of many great restaurants. Bad: The only negative that we saw was the rooms were a little small, but the bed made up for that, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichVATraveler
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our mother to S.F. to celebrate her 80th birthday. After reading many hotel reviews we decided on the Crown Plaza and we were not disappointed. We stayed on the 19th floor in a Jr. Suite and the room was large and had a terrific view of the city. The bathroom was large enough to meet our needs but wish it had a exhaust fan. There was a small refrigerator that we used for bottled water and yogurt. All of the hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. We were especially grateful to the door man who was always ready to give us directions with a smile. This hotel is very centrally located and I would definite recommend it. Also, just across the street is a terrific place for breakfast called Sears. If you don't get there early, there will be a line, but it moves quickly and is worth the short wait. We also had dinner at Sears one evening but it was no match to their wonderful breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, all in all”
Reviews.Author: MemphisMojoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Generally, I dislike almost everything about Crowne Plaza hotels. It's definitely my least favorite "mid-scale" hotel brand. But I was pleasantly surprised by the Crowne Plaza-Union Square in San Francisco. All in all, this property is not bad. For starters, the rooms are relatively spacious, at least by San Francisco standards. The location is excellent. And the rate was relatively inexpensive by San Francisco standards. (I was fortunate enough to qualify for a corporate rate that was about 40% less than the hotel's standard rack rate.) To top it off, the view from my room on the 23rd floor was outstanding. (Rooms on upper level floors with views of San Francisco Bay command a slight rack rate surcharge. But the surcharge is apparently waived for some corporate-rate guests.) My dislikes about the hotel: A very bland, uninspiring decorating scheme, which seems to be highly typical of most Crowne Plaza locations. Inadequate air conditioning in the lobby, elevators, hallways and other common areas. (The weather was unusually warm during my stay, with temperatures in the mid 70s.) Somewhat worn and outdated room furnishings and carpenting. Would I stay here again? Yes, if the price was right. Would I stay here if I had to pay anything close to the rack rate? Definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised at the Crowne”
Reviews.Author: Ted Fry
Reviews.Content: Although check-in was slow and wonky, this was to be expected during the huge convention weekend of our stay (10/20/06). Beyond its central location and comfortable rooms, there were notable unexpected bonuses: excellent, restful bedding (critical after a cross-country flight); friendly, accommodating staff; insulation from street noise superior to most other area hotels, and absolutely breathtaking views from the upper floors. Oh, and they don't go smoke-free after accepting a smoking reservation (hear that, Marriott?) My only complaints were the indifferent concierge and the tiny (for a place of its size) lobby. Overall, a solid, reliable choice in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Option For SFO”
Reviews.Author: rickson10
Reviews.Content: very good located with friendly people, this hotel is a very good option for san francisco. we arrived 23 sept via dallas from argentina and stayed 5 nights. check-in was fast and without problems. i found the room small but confortable and clean negative : no safety box and mini-bar in the room. all the other were fine. the relation hotel-price was very good and i recommend make the reservation with breakfast. very good location for a very nice city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ER2
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in a standard king room, on the 21st floor, which offered a nice view of Nob Hill. Room was terribly small, but cozy, fresh looking and very clean. The bedding was amazingly comfortable...and nice Crowne amenities were provided to ensure a restful sleep. Great shower, and clean but small bathroom. Room was quiet, windows kept the street noise out. Small but clean lobby, with a nice little bar. Service was very friendly and top notch. Internet access ($10/day, $5/hr) was reliable, wireless is available in the lobby area as well. Valet parking was quite expensive ($40/day), however you can opt to park 2 doors down in the Sutter St garage for $27/day ($30/day with in/out). Great location for shopping, strolling around Union Square, the art galleries, museums & more. Fine restaurants aplenty in the immediate area, and Chinatown is pretty close as well. Cablecar to the Wharf stops right across the street (they are usually quite full from passengers starting the ride at Union Square, so you may have to wait for a few cars to go by before finding room on one). Despite having had a smallish room, it was a good value for location and level of service. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: TomMQuinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights. The room was large and nicely furnished - it was on one of the higher floors (25th). The deli next door is good for breakfast, as is the diner adjacent and the french cafe opposite. The bar and restaurant lack soul, but there are plenty of other places close by which mean you don't have to eat there. Perfect location for all things downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: stinkie
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel for the 1st 4 nights of a 2 week holiday to celebrate our 25th anniversary and were immediately impressed with both the hotel and the staff. we were shown our room by a lovely bell-boy and were very pleased - we were on the 22nd floor and had a great view! the room itself was very large, 2 double beds, comfy armchair and footstool by the window, work desk, tv etc, large bathroom although not sure about the wallpaper!-the rest of the room was plainer, plenty of hanging space. the bed was very comfy, air con and opening window. very clean, plenty of space, and what a location! the cable car stop is right outside {although it was always full]},shops, restaurants,china town all on the doorstep and we walked pretty much everywhere, even to fishermans wharf, coit tower, lombard street etc- good exercise, nice to get a "feel" for the city, and we could enjoy the great food knowing we;d earned it!for a hotel in the heart of san fran this was brilliant - didn;t try the restaurant although it smelled good when you walked through the lobby! we used lori;s diner across the road for breakfast - lovely and very retro - and ate out every night. it was great at the end of a long day to relax with a glass of wine and look at the view and again at night with a nightcap looking at all the lights.

Reviews.Title: “crowne plaza union square was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: artemis_zeus
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 teenage kids and myself just returned from 5 days in SF. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Union Square and had a large beautiful room with a wonderful view, generous breakfasts(Only $10 more than the regular room rate for 2 breakfasts). The hotel was in a great locaton (Sutter and Powell) so just 1 block off Union Square. The room was quiet, had air conditioning, (which was needed due to a heat wave) and can't think of anything wrong with the hotel, staff, etc. We checked in a few hours early without problems. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: San Fran was our first port of call on a month long trip. We arrived before checkin time but they allowed us to check straight in. The service was second to none, with everyone from the front desk and concierge to the bartender/room service (a special mention to Tom) totally professional, courteous and friendly. Our room was well appointed, well serviced and large. We liked it so much we rebooked for our return to San Fran before flyng home to Australia. It's handy to shops, restaurants and local attractions. The cable cars to Fishermans wharf run alongside the hotel and Chinatown is just around the corner. It's a tad expensive but we definitely got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Crowne”
Reviews.Author: Vesta64
Reviews.Content: We came to San Francisco for a family holiday and were greatly surprised and pleased with our stay and service from the staff at this hotel. The conceirge and door staff were very knowledgable and assisted at every opportunity. The front desk staff were really pleasant and helpful as well. The beds were outstanding and great to fall into at the end of our day. Did not have an opportunity to eat at the hotel as there were too many options nearby that we took advantage of - some of which we were guided to by the door men. Will definitely stay here again, a great hotel in a very safe area and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: ScotandHelen
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service from the front desk. Not friendly, not helpful. An older type hotel, looked a bit run down. Needs a makeover to bring it up to the mark. 4 outta 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: techmom64
Reviews.Content: Great location with great access to public transportation. We jumped on the cable car to take us everywhere. Close to chinatown and walking distance to many retail shops. Hotel was somewhat pricey but very very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked hotwire and got a great deal. Staff were friendly and helpful, particularly the porters. The room was large with an extremely comfortable bed. Furnishings were bland but nice enough. Fantastic location right on Union Square, close to numerous shops and restaurants and a couple of blocks from Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, had a wonderful stay on our first trip to the States. The location was good for walking to China Town, the shops and getting the cable car. Our room was big, airy and very clean. Would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Feb 12-19 2006. We loved the hotel. Had an oversized junior suite that was a corner room and very spacious with sitting area. The staff at this hotel were most pleasant. Every single one. The hotel was convenient because it was so central. It wasn't too far from anywhere. I had a conference at the Moscone Center and it was a very pleasant 5-10 min. walk. When we left we forgot a very sentimental blanket in our baby's crib. We forgot to call back for about 2 weeks and to our surprise, they had found and kept the blanket. Not only that but they mailed it to us at their expense. Now that's what I call service. Thanks Crowne Plaza San Francisco for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ladylawyer42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a overnight business trip. I had stayed here quite a few years ago, and recalled that it was pretty nice, but was not sure what to expect this time. I was pleasantly surprised. The front desk was very helpful (printing out boarding pass for the next day's flight) and upgraded me without being asked to a junior suite. The room was huge, with the king-sized bed separated from the sofa/sitting area by a low wall. It was a corner room, with bay windows on two walls. The bed was very comfortable, and I liked the relaxation cd provided. The bathroom was pretty tiny, but had a good shower and fluffy towels. I had dinner and breakfast from room service, which was prompt, and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shop_boston
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walk to shops/restaurants in Union Square and Nob Hill. Convinient to public transportation. Rooms above average, clean. Stayed in the "quiet zone" which was nice-- wasn't bothered by street noise like in a lot of the other Union Square hotels. Would stay here again, good value for the SF area if you can find a deal online.

Reviews.Title: “Just PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms when staying in San Francisco for a friend's birthday treat. I travel a lot on business - this hotel exceeded my expectations. It was one of the best decisions of the trip. I split the holiday between two hotels in the city and really regretted leaving the Crowne Plaza. (1) Location An easy walk from the Powell Street BART station (I took the BART from the airport). Great for shopping, being two blocks from Union Square. Great for all the city-centre attractions. The cable-car stops outside reception! Takes you down to Powell / Market Street, or down to Fishermans Wharf. (2) Rooms We had a standard room. Quality and cleanliness very high. Most rooms seem to have a large bay window. My room was at the back of the hotel and I could see the bay and quite a lot of the city, including Coit Tower and the Transamerica Pyramid. The bay window is great. The room is bigger as a result and you get a much wider view from your hotel. The beds are very comfortable. Every room has a CD player and they even provide a relaxing "sleep-advantage" CD. (3) Food / Facilities Didn't try the restaurant - so many choices in San Fran!! The breakfast was great (Crowne Plaza's usual standard). There is also a coffee-shop / Deli in the hotel that does fantastic egg & bacon breakfast muffins - dangerous!! Lot's of coffee choices, bagels, muffins, cereals etc - I recommend it for a faster getaway in the morning. There is a friendly bar. We were also given vouchers on arrival that gave you a free drink in the bar and concessions at the restaurant etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, small room”
Reviews.Author: HappyHiker88
Reviews.Content: I was in SF on business and this was one of the few places that had the number of nights I needed, six, and was close to the Moscone Center. I was able to get a corporate rate of $130 plus tax for each night. The staff service was excellent. The bell captains helped me with a ride to the airport and were exceptional in their service, the housekeeping staff helped me with some laundry, the housekeeping staff kept my room neat and tidy, the wake-up service actually came to check on me when I was unable to get to the phone to answer the wake-up call, etc. This place had better staff service than grander hotels where I have stayed. The room was smaller than some other rooms I've had, but it had a king-sized bed, a chair and ottoman, a desk, and a dresser. The TV was set on on a stand that wasn't in front of the bed, so it was uncomfortable to watch. My room gave me a view of Powell Street and I could hear the cable car bell occasionally, but overall, being on the 10th floor, the street sound wasn't bad; the only time it woke me up was when sirens were going by. The sleep kit they give you is really, really nice; I am a light sleeper, so this was very much appreciated. The bath products are very nice. Herbal and spa like. It was one of the better lines I've had in hotels; even nicer than the Parc 55, where I stayed a year ago. The location is great. There's a 24-hour Walgreens across the street, lots of casual restaurants nearby, a short walk to Union Square, a 10-minute walk to the Moscone Center, a short walk to Chinatown, a Wells Fargo machine nearby, etc. The location is far superior to the Parc 55, the only other SF hotel I've visited. The drapes had a stain on them, and the carpet seemed old and musty, but otherwise, the room was furnished nicely. The bed linens seemed very clean, including the duvet cover, which is important to all travelers. The hotel has a Cafe Fresco, which has great hours and a nice selection of foods to go, as well as some seating. For a business traveller, like myself, this was great. My one complaint is that I could smell food smells one night. I don't know if a neighboring room had room service or if the smell came in from the heating and cooling units. It was gross though. There was no way to open the window to air out my room. If I return to SF next December, I might stay there again, but I might try another hotel just to try something different.

HotelInfo.Name: San Francisco Marriott Union Square
HotelInfo.Address: 480 Sutter Street, San Francisco, CA 94108 (Formerly Hotel 480)
